0:46 Mins You get two pairs of socks in this pack. I have the black socks with rainbow stripes.They look quite funky and are extremely comfortable.I've found myself not only using these socks for exercise and yoga, I also use them for walking around the house. I have never liked being barefoot, so these are perfect for when my feet are too hot for slippers (yes, that is a thing) and still want something on my feet without having to worry about slipping. I have the full yoga socks, so these are a great hot weather alternative.When I am exercising (I'm so glad nobody tapes those torture sessions) they have a great grip, regardless of whether I am on the floor or using a yoga mat.It's best to hand-wash the socks, so they don't shrink and the non-slip dots don't lose any traction.The Hobbit wears a UK size 5/6 and the socks in the video are a size S-M.The socks come with a link to the yoga-addict website and a free bonus guide 'Top 10 Tips A Yoga Practitioner Should Know To Get The Most From Your Yoga Practice' and a discount for further purchases.Overall a quality product.I received a free copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.

What do you if you have totally failed at dating and are still looking for Mr Right? Start your own exclusive dating agency of course. That is exactly what Ellie Rigby decides to do. Help all those other good-looking singles out there to find their perfect match.Sounds simple enough, eh? Well it does until Ellie realises just how many of her potential clients are just ever so slightly eccentric and high maintenance. I'm not sure I would be able to find a partner for a macho playboy gynaecologist with a porn-star name either.Of course the problem with sifting through all those handsome men is that inevitably there will be one of them, who just happens to caught your eye. Not even matchmakers are immune to the charms of Cupid.It's got to be Perfect is a comedy of errors with a bevy of pretty people with one thing in common, the search for Mr or Mrs Perfect.Hill doesn't mince her words when it comes to the dialogues, They are refreshing, witty and occasionally slightly on the graphic side. She has her main character concentrate her efforts on the top ten percent, as opposed to the more normal looking single. Beauty attracts mates and not plain Janes, is the message, which leaves a slightly negative tinge to the otherwise light-hearted story.I received a copy of this book, courtesy of Mills & Boon and Harlequin UK.

I really enjoyed the in-depth view into anorexia. Although the storyline flows into the lives of the characters and melds flawlessly into the other sub-plots, there is still a level of understanding about this eating disorder, which is quite remarkable. The kind of depth you usually only get when you read a book written specifically about eating disorders.Kate Long really does have Helen's character down to a tee. Anorexics are often described in a way that defines them as victims, as attention seeking individuals, who could stop being anorexic if they wanted to.Those descriptions could not be more wrong. It is a mental illness, a feeding and eating disorder. Girls, boys men or women, who suffer with it need professional medical and psychological help.Getting back to the way Long has portrayed Helen. She has pinpointed the manipulative, cunning and deceptive nature of her personality. Anorexics learn to lie, deceive, cheat and manipulate their surroundings and the people around them.Feeding and Eating disorders are about control. Controlling the one thing no one else can control for you or take away from you. The way you eat, how much you eat or if you eat at all. It takes an incredible amount of inner discipline to control your eating habits that way.Helen describes the anorexia as an entity, a person, someone who lives within her and tells her how useless, fat and ugly she is. Alive to the point of having inner dialogues with her or it. Like an inner demon sitting on your shoulder.Long also describes the way the anorexia can make and break a family. Everything evolves around the eating disorder, which means everyone suffers, not just the anorexic. In this story we follow the healthy sister Jen on her quest for love and her constant juggle of work-life balance. Even now her sister has recovered there is always this doubt about her honesty. Is she in distress, is she getting skinnier again or is she eating her food?When Helen asks Jen to find one of the people partly responsible for the initial meltdown, she finds herself in the middle of a moral dilemma. Help her and perhaps watch Helen spiral into her anorexia again or trust that Helen will leave the past alone.This isn't just a story about family dynamics when one of the family members suffers from an eating disorders, it is also a story about the relationship between two sisters and how romance can sneak up on you in the strangest situations.I received a free copy of this book courtesy of the author.

At the moment my girls are all trying to bag all of these Kabuki brushes and sharing seems to be the last thing on their minds, that is how nice these brushes are.There may be chemical smell emanating from the bag when you get it. You need to wash them before use anyway, and it will rid the brushes of any smell. Just soak them in warm water with some shampoo for about 30 minutes. Then air dry them if possible hair-end down. After you have used them and want to clean them it will suffice to just wash them out with a very mild shampoo.The only thing that was slightly negative is the gold feature, it doesn't gel with the rest of the brush, from a quality point of view. Other than that the bristles are super soft. On the pics I have included, the colour of the bristles is slightly beige because they are already in use by the high maintenance girls in our household (Just Kidding...they are not high maintenance, just finnicky about the make-up apparel they use)EmaxDesign also has a similar set in bamboo, which is also very nice and it has a eyebrow brush and smaller fat Kabuki brushes.Knowing how much just a single Kabuki brush costs, even the synthetic ones, this is quite a good price for the set.I received a free copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.

The colour is actually more of a vibrant red, as opposed to the orangey auburn red shown in the product images (the customer images show a more accurate colour. I think the colour in the image should be updated to reflect the actual colour of the wig.It comes in a bag you can use to store the wig in, a wig comb/brush and a wigcap.It is easy to wash. Just use a little baby shampoo or mild shampoo and air dry the synthetic hair. It is adjustable and should fit most heads.Length is about midback.It is certainly striking, so people with definitely see you coming.Interestingly enough one of my youngest daughters has a friend (17/18), who is into the whole japanese manga and girl doll look. She has asked to use this wig to create one of her special and creative 'looks' on her own youtube channel.It is suitable for any fancy dress costume occasion, halloween or even if you just happen to like changing your hair and general appearance very day.I received a copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.

You should clean the brushes first before you use them. Just wash with warm water and a little shampoo and soak for 30 mins, to eliminate any smell. After that you just use shampoo and water to get rid of old make-up residue. Most importantly, leave the brushes to air dry with the hair end pointing downwards.The brushes come individually wrapped in an orange velvety drawstring bag and a manual. It includes Foundation Brush, Big Eye shadow Brush, High Light Brush, Eye Smudge Brush, Concealer Brush, Eyebrow Brush, Small Eye shadow Brush, Blusher Brush, Eyelash Brush, Multifunction Foundation Brush, Multifunction Blush Brush, Mini Kabuki BrushMy three daughters have been testing these, and unfortunately there has been a tug of war to test them and a second set of Golden Black brushes. They are excellent quality with really fine hair and are easy to both use and clean.The set is really god value for money when you thin about how much you pay for individual brushes, especially Kabuki brushes. Just one can cost the same price as this whole set.I received a free copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.

Leofric is what I would call a wee bit of an anti-hero. He has the bad luck of a thrice cursed peasant, suffers with debilitating health issues and has the get-go of a snail. Everyone around him equates his ill health to an overall weakness in character, and because they believe it Leofric believes it.Luckily, despite all that he is a sympathetic chappy, who just always seems to draw the short end of the straw. The real issue with Leofric isn't really all of the above, although it has a lot to do with it, is the fact he hasn't found his inner dragon yet.In essence this whole story is about Leofric becoming the man he was always intended to be. The reader follows him on his road to growth, which is filled with violence, murder, fear and the occasional bout of wit.Arnott has created a main character with flaws and a propensity for failure. He doesn't look for trouble, but trouble sure finds him quite a lot. Something tells me Leofric will eventually rise like the phoenix from the ashes.I found myself being drawn in by Leofric and his unusual story. I needed to know what else could possibly go wrong for him. How on earth was he going to make it to the end of the book?Arnott knows how to reel you without you even realising it. It wasn't just his storytelling though, for me it was the way I connected as a reader to the main character. I am looking forward to reading the rest of his journey now that his inner dragon is starting to pipe up and breathe fire.I received a free copy of this book, courtesy of the author, for purposes of review.

Works with horizontal vent slots, so it will depend on the make and model of your car. The size and weight of your phone might not work with this car mount. The mount is quite lightweight and so are the air-vents, so the mount might not be able to hold the weight of a larger, heavier phone and it may just fall out of the vent.It didn't work well with a Samsung 6, a Notebook and a Samsung 5, but it was just fine with an Iphone5.I think the whole success of the product fails or succeeds with the mount being installed in the vents, that is aside from the fact the vents could snap if man-handled too much.The nose of the mount (which is the part that is attached to the vent) is made of a soft rubbery material.Other than that it is easy to install and easy to use.I received a free copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.

After the phenomenal success of her novel The Good Girl, Kubica is back with another compelling read. The type of read that makes you have a conversation with the fictional main characters of a book.Women are expected to shut up and endure, swallow and forget. It doesn't really matter why or what, they are just expected to grin and bear whatever comes their way. When you spend years of bottling up your emotions without any outlet, then psychological and sometimes even physical damage is the result of those pent-up emotions.In Heidi's case the shut up and put on a brave face faade begins to crumble when she invites Willow and Ruby into her house and her life. She slowly becomes obsessed with Ruby, and the thought of Willow leaving makes her almost irrational.Once again Mary Kubica leaves it up to the reader to decide who the bad guys and the good guys are. Believe you me, it is never so cut and dry with a Kubica story. The truth of the matter is that there is a bit of both in all of us.Kubica merges important social topics with emotional scenarios and family dynamics. She delves into the foster care system, child abuse and most importantly the apathy of our society towards the most vulnerable.The opening chapters are an eye-opener and are food for thought. What would you do in the same situation? Look away or show some compassion? Unfortunately in the world we live in the number of incidents taking place in connection with the so-called bystander effect are on the rise. People look away rather than get involved. In a way this is one of the reasons Heidi reaches out instead of just turning her back.This is a psychological thriller with muddied waters when it comes to the good guys and the bad guys, but then that is exactly what Kubica excels at.I received a free copy of this book, courtesy of Mira UK and Harlequin UK, for purposes of review.

I suggest reading the first book in the series, Queen of the Tearling, before this one. It isn't a necessity, but it does make things a whole lot clearer. In the beginning of Invasion of the Tearling.A lot of the fates of the characters from the first book are introduced in the first few chapters, so a new reader to this series might have a wee bit of difficulty keeping track of who, why and when.It has one of the strangest present to past time evolution plots I have read in quite a while.The past is described as a post-apocalyptic misogynistic world, and the present is an almost medieval fantasy like world with plenty of magic, but with echoes of the 21st century.Although the slipping from one life into another is quite interesting it doesn't seem to have much point other than to validate family connections.Lily's story or rather the world she lives in is quite interesting. A world where women have no rights at all, and men are free to do with them as they please. Including abuse them when they feel like it. Sounds rather medieval, despite all the modern trappings, doesn't it? Whereas in Kelsea's world the women rule the roost. Although some of those misogynistic elements are reflected in Kelsea's world, especially in certain male high-born leaders.Overall it is a creative fantasy driven by power struggles and family secrets.I received a copy of this book via NetGalley.

I really like the way these look. They look like tiny soup cans with a bobble on the end.They came with two extra sets of earbud covers, in different sizes, which means you can choose from three.You can also adjust the sound and click/switch to the next track.There are three controls on the earphones, a volume button/slider, a Other/Nokia switch and a play/pause switch.There are 3 controls: a volume slider, a Nokia/Other switch and a play/pause switch. All work fine! No issues at all.You can answer your phone calls with the remote button, and if you're listening to music it will automatically resume when the call ends.I have tested them on my Samsung 5, a Samsung 6, Ipad mini, Iphone 5 and Kindle Fire.The only thing I felt was a negative, was the fact there is not Left or Right marking on the earbuds. I believe this is because both of the buds are exactly the same, as opposed to being slightly formed in one direction, depending on the ear you wear them in. Then again it saves me from having an 'moment' when I need to ame sure the right bud is in the right ear.It doesn't block out all the external noise and the music can be heard by others if it is turned up loud. The cable is a decent length at 120cm.It also comes with 18 months warrantyI received a free copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.

1:14 Mins This is definitely my type of phone case, and no matter which phone/upgrade, I always end up getting a wallet type case, because it makes me feel as if my phone is safer.It has two horizontal pockets for cards and a larger vertical pocket on the left-hand inside of the case. The right-hand inside has two things, it holds the secondary case that holds the phone. This secondary case is magnetic, which means you can extract it from the wallet case at any time, and put it back in.The secondary case can be used by itself as a case, if you don't feel like carrying the wallet part around. The wallet case has a magnetic fastener, which just clips around the front of the case.Personally I think this case looks really smart. The wallet case keeps my phone from being mauled, smudged or damaged by all kinds of dangerous things in my Mary Poppins handbag.I received a free copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.

I have to say I do prefer the enclosed wallet or book-like type of cases. The one-side open ones always make me feel as if it is an accident waiting to happen.Saying that, I have a Samsung 6 user at home, who prefers this type of open case. she likes to be able to access the phone straight away, as opposed to opening it up to use it.This is clear It has an anti-scratch coating and the material absorbs shocks, ergo falls and bumps. The case has a protective sheet over it, so it arrives with shiny clean with no marks on it. The corners are rounded, and they have small ridges underneath, so the phone is actually raised slightly when you lay it down.The advantages of using this type of clear case is being able to see the actual phone from both the front and the back.I received a free copy of this product, courtesy of the company, for purposes of review.

This was my first Lisa Gardner and it certainly won't be my last. She really knows how to keep the story compelling to the very end.Nicky is haunted by a girl called Vero. The two of them have conversations with each other all the time, or do they? Is it reality, a call from her subconscious or perhaps just hallucinations due to the complications of Nicky's traumatic brain injury?Nicky comes to the attention of the local police when she is found hailing help by the side of the road and her car is found at the bottom of a ravine. At the scene of the accident she screams for Vero, so the hunt is on for the missing child.When the police come up empty handed they start to question not only the accident, they also question Nicky's sanity. Something just doesn't ring quite right for Wyatt and he starts taking a closer look at the husband, especially because Nicky has had multiple serious accidents in the last few months.I really enjoyed the way Gardner kept the question about the identities very fluid throughout the book. Nothing is certain, and the reader is always second guessing who she might be. You automatically feel sympathy for Vero the child and Nicky the adult, regardless of whether they are in the past or present. For the victims of the abuse and the adult, who lives in sheer terror of the truth. Her own truth is so devastating she is literally falling apart bit by bit.Although this is a Tessa Leoni mystery/case she doesn't really play a major role in this story. More like the sidekick to Wyatt. The two of them do get a wee bit closer, but overall she plays more of a secondary part in the book.I have to admit it kept me riveted till the end.I received a free copy of this book via Netgalley.

You need to check where your cigarette lighter outlet is in your car before buying this car mount. I didn't think it would work like most, but it really does! Awesome! Keep in mind this tightens and breaks down your fat in the area you apply. I lost several inches using the body wraps. However, if you don't use them correctly the wraps will not be effective. When you wrap the most benefit is going to come from using a full treatment which is 5 wraps. The first time I wrapped I didn't notice any results.  After full treatment my skin was tighten and firm; and I did it along with healthy eating and exercise. I got this to keep in my glove compartment for whenever I need to check my tire pressure. Keeping the tires of my car right inflated save me a lot in fuel and tires as well. I'm not exactly an expert on headphone quality. My review is just my experience. I must say these earbuds look very nice. I tried out the head phones at the gym, they were good at cancelling out the background noise and did not fall out the minute I got warm! In the morning before I go to work I like to make myself a cup of good tea, as soon as I make it, I realize I need to leave for work. To carry a mug full of tea while walking to work is not the best idea, but now I have this slick, stylish looking tea tumbler.When I was offered to test this product, I was beyond excited to get one. I've been experimenting with it since I received mine. I should state that this is my first tumbler and I cannot rave enough about it. It is a glass bottle with a stainless steel strainer that sits inside the top of the tumbler. The strainer itself is very nice quality metal with a little handle and small holes so that less loose tea gets into the beverage while steeping. The lid is spill proof, I tipped it over on its lid while full of tea and none came out. The only drawback I found is that this tea infuser is NOT dishwasher or microwave safe.For tea with long steeping times I like this method:This is preferred to steep your tea on the go and then pour into a mug at work and whatnot than as a travel mug. How I used it was to put the tea leaves in the tumbler, add water, and then place the strainer, lock it. You can turn tumbler upside down to steep, if you like, and then turn over when finished.Possible issues: While this method is great for those long steep time, most teas will get bitter if over steeped.Another method for tea with limited steeping times.Place strainer in the bottle. Once you've put your tea leaves into the strainer, the glass container with water, screw the lid on very tight and you need to turn tumbler upside down to steep. When the steeping is complete, turn it back over and remove strainer with leaves.Possible issues: Some of the leaves do tend to get through, because the holes on the strainer are a little too big. I recommend using larger leafed teas with this tumbler.All in all, really neat tea infuser, perfect for on the go.Sample product for review courtesy of WeiHeng

I am a big fan of Matcha Green Tea. I have always loved Matcha green tea and would always order green tea lattes at any coffee shop that makes them. I love the taste of green tea powder and it is a plus that there are so many nutritional benefits to it. Matcha is extremely healthy; it's loaded with antioxidants and vitamins, helps lower blood pressure, and can also be used as a weight loss supplement (in conjunction with a healthy diet, of course), and because of the L-theanine amino acid that is present in the leaf, it will actually produce a drip-effect when it comes to caffeine. That is, the caffeine you consume will be distributed evenly throughout the day instead of you getting it all at once and then crashing when it's gone. This Matcha is great, isn't as bitter/pungent as the last one I've had from another retailer. This one mixes better as well, no more tea clumps floating around my mug. The taste is sweet, light, and airy. This tea is quite smooth and carries almost no astringency or bitterness. A very light chalkiness coats the mouth. The light coat is mainly in the front and is a bit lacking in the back. I found this to be a very enjoyable ceremonial grade matcha. I will be drinking it again for sure. I received this product at a discount for quality evaluation and review purposes

Seau was a brilliant young athlete, gifted, motivated and devoted to his family and culture. I remember him well from his time with the New England Patriots where he was well regarded and very much a fan favorite.In this short narrative about Seau's life (200+ pages) he seems to have spent much of his life trying to please people and live up to the expectations of his Samoan culture. The book really skims the surface of the popular NFL star's life, lacking depth of detail but covering everything.The end of this life is a moving and distressing section which the author really leaves us with more unanswered questions. Should the book have been longer?Trotter does he's best detailed writing when covering Seau's football career but that's really not enough to carry the book. Altogether it's not a bad read and does offer some insight it the subject life.

Rosemary, The Hidden Kennedy Daughter, explores the life of Rosemary Kennedy, the eldest daughter of Rose and Joseph Kennedy, and sister to John F., Robert and Edward (Ted) Kennedy.I believe the author, Kate Larson has done her best to unearth new information and present that information in a non-provocative and edifying way.Rosemary was intellectually challenged in an era when families (especially those of status) didn't acknowledge such disabilities.Larson, shows just how much effort the Kennedy's (Joe and Rose) invested in attempting to hide their daughter's challenges and also how intensely they tried to help her move forward (or 'cure' her) before resorting to the difficult decision to proceed with a lobotomy.I can question why and how certain decisions were may have been made in this family, which is a tribute to the author; she allows as best she can to show various sides of Rosemary's story.ROSEMARY is a quick and engaging read. At times I think there was information relayed (like the constant changes in schools by the subject) which read like a travelogue without a guide. that aside, Larson does a good job of sharing Rosemary's story without being distracted by the Kennedy family itself. Rosemary, is highlighted, her family is the sidebar.I thought it promised more than it delivered to a small extant but regardless, makes for informative reading.

Love the vanilla -- mint over the original scent which (while better than a poo-poo odor!) always reminded me of the scent of a mostly cleaned public bathroom.Still over all I love this product especially in a house of men! It makes a huge difference and solution for one of life's little unappealing problems.This scent (vanilla mint) is clean and refreshing without smelling like an overwhelming air freshener.Couldn't recommend highly enough!

As a dental hygienist I use this brand at work and have NEVER had any issue with them, thin enough to double glove yet strong enough for a good protective barrier. Lots and lots of tactile sensitivity, def. one of the best brands I've ever used.At home this are terrific for handling food and house cleaning.Most def. recommended!

Nice cotton feel and it washed well, the color is really pretty also. It has a nice light hand while not being flimsy. I appreciated the long waits ties.They can either be tied in the back or looped all around to the front, which was my preference. I wasn't fond of the adjustable neck loop though once in place and at the correct height it was fine though after washing it was even a bit more difficult. Still, the coverage of this apron more than makes up for one fault.

LAPD Det. Jacob Lev is faced with coping with family secrets revealed and not in a good way; while on the job he begins investigating a cold case of a long ago double murder which intersects with his past. The story itself intersects many paths leaving this reader confused. When asked how to describe the characters I described them as complex, this is not meant to be a compliment. They're complicated because they're muddled. it was difficult to get a grip on the story with the bewildering continuing changing of scenes and 'themes' from murder mystery to sci-fi to horror. The transitions are poor which is a shame since the writing is good. By the time this disjointed story comes into its own you wonder if it was worth the read.
Huge! Covers a grand portion of my front porch while looking great and picking up dirt...easy clean with the hose (lightly)Totally recommend.

If used correctly this is an excellent product. The key word is moderate incontinence. Due to a sub-total coletomy with reattachment years ago at times I have to deal with mild fecal incontinence when sleeping this is perfect, anything heavier and you'd have to try a different version in the Depends line.To their credit though they are snug and though I don't wear them under my clothes I tried them on under a variety of clothes; They fit well under jeans and leggings (accompanied by a tunic top) not so much with yoga pants.

Three 15x14 canvas bags, natural, navy, white and navy striped, these could not be more perfect. The is just right even for grocery shopping (I prefer NOT to have my bags overfilled). They're great great for beach carry all though you would need more than one depending on the crowd. I take one to work, carry lunch, books, essentials..it gets dirty, I wash and have a back up.So many uses!Kids could use these, beach bags, overnight bags, waiting room bags.Well made, wash well (will need ironing)A canvas bag is a canvas bag but how upscale not to have logos on it as a bonus! (Summer handbags too!)

I like packing cubes in general especially for lingere, medicine and chargers, even more so when packing a carry on which this set is perfect for.As other reviewers have stated the large fall more into medium category though with thinner summer clothing I'm surprised what I can fit in there and at times it keeps me from over packing (two nights!)Well made (Eagle Creek is a great brand) I find these invaluable even on longer trips. My suitcase is organized so the continual shuffling through it has ceased--- also amazing for ease of repacking. Again, this sets best use -- carry on, but don't limit yourself to that, longer trips, household organization (think small objects) and perfect for diaper bags.

Either I'm missing something or I'm baffled at the idea of paying (received gratis for fair review) $11+ for a binder?It is as stated a 1" D ring binder, lays flat when open, two pockets and some pretty standard cooking measurements printed on them. The collage on the binder is adorable but I can head to a Dollar store and pick up 1" binder, fancy it up, PURCHASE INSERTS  (not included with Avery's) for my recipes for the same or less. Lacking.

I didn't find Colgate Enamel Health Whitening Toothpaste to be superior nor inferior to any other major brand on the market. It's main ingredient, sodium fluoride is found in every brand that I know of except one and when speaking to my rep about this there was no clear answer beyond sales talk. Yes, it contains silica, this will smooth the tooth surface: I'm almost certain most brands of toothpaste contain this and can make the same claim. I found no whitening ingredients in it. I had no problems with the taste though that's subjective. It's a fluoride toothpaste basically and it's going to do its job the rest is really just marketing.

Doug Harvey is in desperate need of a ghost writer and a seriously good, honest and tough editorThis overly confident major league baseball umpire has tales and lessons worth reading about but he's essentially so obsessed with his own perfection he never gets beyondAbbreviated versions of classic stories which don't explore the depth of the game, the humanity, aggravation, frustion, drama and humor the umpire brings to it.This is about how good Doug is, how good Doug thinks he is and making sure everyone else knows he's as God-like as he's convinced he is.It's too bad, had he put his ego aside, concentrated on the inside stories (and invested in a proof reader) this would have had potential. As it is it's just a poorly written vanity project .

This is a little big but I had no say in the size I received, though considering What I'm using it for I'm fine with it, also it's not huge (5' 3" 140) just gave me some extra room. I'm using it for the beginning and end of yoga and barre classes and I dont like to struggle in and out of a work out shirt. Depending on your comfort level order to size or up. True to size would have been a medium which is what I would have ordered.The colors are beautiful (Greek Isle), the mesh on the side really allows it to breath and I love the zipper...it has some real length to it.Well made. (Amazon never gives you enough time to know how it will handle multiple washings.) love that there is no tag on the inside. Great product.
Order down a size, these run big -- if I could order down a half size they'd fit perfect.Typical poly blend.

This 60x80 tablecloth is more attractive in person even though it resembles the picture quite well. The textures and dimension and liveliness for what seems like a very simple statement piece really make this a nice piece to own or give as a gift, in fact dressed the right way this staple can be used everyday or you can get creative with it for any event.How well it holds up over time and repeated washings is an unanswered question. It went through its first cycle fine and needed only a bit of ironing.
Run really large, had to return for a medium and I always wear an xl. Maybe the sizing is a throwback to reality?

"Professor Wolf tells the incredible story of how one woman was able to perform deception, heresy, seduction and murder in the heart of the Catholic Church."The trailer is more descriptive and exciting than the book.This is an excellently written work on the deceptive and evil practices of the convent of Sant'Ambrogio in Rome by its young mistress Maria Luisa which occurred in and about 1858 and were brought to light by the German princess Katherina Von Hohenzollern. The Princes was a rather fragile, matronly soul and certainly not a figure one would think to bring about such a scandal to the open yet with her society and familial connections she was exactly the type of hysterical personality unable to mentally cope, she broke, she 'escaped ' she sparked an investigation.And Wolf chronicles this investigation minutely, covering every detail available, making use of primary and secondary source materials and while informative it's dry going. He has a writing style of breaking his trail of information and diverting down another alley before returning to his main thought which became darn irritating and at times irrelevant.Which is not to say this is not a well sourced nor well written book nor does my history have to be spoon fed to me but a little dose of sugar and a drop less confusion plus the promised dirty scandal  makes for a more enjoyable read.
I weigh 140 and theses X-L fit perfectly.Good quality, no piling at least after the first wash.They do sit low if that's a concern. This work well as both leggings and yoga pants.

Overall I really like the size of this grater even though it has a larger footprint than most because of this you get a nice even swipe producing a lovely zest.It's quite sharp and really gets the job done.I don't find the zest (tried a lemon and an orange) oversized like some reviewers have mentioned I was delighted with the way it worked.Great, large non- slip handle also a major plus!

The key to the OXO is all in the oversized food holder as far as I'm concerned. It is magnificent for keeping your hands away from the blades while allowing you use almost every bit of your choice of cheese, fruit or vegetable.The stainless steel blades are brilliantly sharp and get the job done. I wash in the top rack of the dishwasher and let air dry on storage setting (another beautiful plus about this mandolin.)All the legs, bottom attached and upper folded hold nicely when in use, no slipping. The grip is large and comfortable.The settings, located at the top of the mandolin are easy to use, three settings for thickness (and the thin really is delicate, very nice) another for julienne and one for storage.I'm extremely pleased with the OXO, very excited to finally own a mandolin that isn't attacking my fingers in a bloody rage:-). If I had any quibble it would be its size, it's a bit bulky, but maybe you can't gey all these great features without a little extra footprint.

I was wavering on whether to place my Fire HD6 in a case at all since I enjo the slim, weightlessness of the ereader.Given the opportunity to try the MarBlue Atlas I'm happy to still have a slim, weightless reader.For the money, this is a nice buy, man-made materials and a snug fit with camera and charge accessible.Held in place by clever design that doesn't constrict the view and corner elestics.It stands up well enough in portrait but is rather hopeless in landscape hence four stars along with there's an obvious concern if not treated with some care (e.g likely best not for teens, Tweens or anyone with a perpetual need to fold back the cover) how long it might hold up?

Love these.I don't have to keep washing one over and over and unlike my Rubbermaid 32oz-er, it doesn't stain. Huge, massive plus.Dishwasher safe with no ill effects after multiple washings.It has a nice secure flip top which is the opposite of flimsy.The finger tab or holder is a great feature especially when carrying multiple items, also not flimsy.Fits well in a cup holder and no spillage (you do have to make sure the cover is tightly on)Recommend for room temperature or cold drinks.

This is the ultimate gift for the Star Wars fan and even I think they're pretty cool.Appearance:Black with red tones and an interchangeable Darth Vader plate, more plates are available but have to be purchased separately. an interesting option. They are slightly bulkier or perhaps just saying they're a bit bigger than most decent headseats will do...without added weight.Sound:The sound is crisp for both gaming and music, no tinning. I was quite satisfied with the clarity.The mike is removable (nice feature) a little fragile because of this...as an adult I had no issue with it if I was purchasing for a child I would keep this in mind .Comfort:Well padded and definitely comfortable for hours of gaming or music listening. It is adjustable to your head size and I think that particular arch is a tad wide in width and at least my pair was initially stubborn about movement but I little gentle pulling and pushing sorted that issue.Overall, very satisfied with these headsets.

Like a similar companion piece Landmark City, Boston plaque this solquily of Boston verbage is tastefully humerus and hangs in my opertory where my patients love it, comment on it and it's a great ice-breaker.The font is a bit small, bigger in this case would have been better.Still, it's a fun, attractive hanging perfect for so many decorating ideas.Recommend.

This is a glossy large photo (not poster) which is stunning on site yet loses some magic because of the details.The photo is 2009 (not having it in front of me) from scoreboard details and outdated signage, these may have been overlooked had it been a Championship not random year,This aside its truly a gorgeous photo of Fenway at night.More than decent sized to large be mindful you have an appropriate place to hang.Recommend.

This is a perfect size for a child's room, man cave or office space (my choice) and can easily be grouped with similar items for a more interesting overall design choice.Nice quality (or at least smoothed and squared) with that contemporary vintage look with blurts appropriate to New Englander's: Old South Church, Fenway, Duck Tour and Newbury to name some of the less obvious ones.I really enjoy it as do my patients. It's a great conversation piece and ice-breaker.Recommend.

This is so pretty in person! Fits as expected. Can be both dressy or casual and has quickly become a favorite staple. I love the contrast of wearing with combat boots,Perfect weight.Gorgeous colors.Great purchase,

This has a cityscapes scene on it though it looks very abstract from a distance. Very trendy. Worth the price of admission.Lightweight but with a cardigan or bolero sweater it transition well into Fall.Great length (I'm 5'3") fit perfectly.Very happy with this purchase.

While these are cheerful and traditional towels they don't hold up that way and for the price point you can do better in a discount department store.After the initial washing they snagged and fragged which I may have expected after multiple washings (the way things are made today) certainly not after the first.Two star rating because if you don't plan to use them they are very Americana in the decorative department.

I was eager to try this after reading the mostly positive reviews.I expected to give this product a full month before reviewing but after a week it was too much on my stomach.Saying that I have to add reviewing a supplement is subjective.

Love it! This lunch tote from Rachael Ray is a delight. Perfect size, perfect pockets, perfect insulations the only thing I can't answer is wear and tear but honestly it seems built to last.I love the black, though the bag clean so easily.Cold stays cold and hot stays hot! ( I took broth to,work one day to test it-- four hours later there was no need to reheat it)Yes, I received it gratis (I also received a computer gratis which didn't receive the best reviews) but this is well worth it's $20 price tag.I'm pleased.

Not quite sure how to rate this. I should have been given a choice of sizes but I wasn't. I believe had I been four stars would be appropriate.I would have like a lot more compression. The fabric is lightweight and breaths nicely.I'm sure when ordering (not through Vine) and receiving the correct size this will be a good product.

I love this. Not overly sweet. Great tasting. I get two uses out of one cup when filling up a 32oz bottle. I have a hard time finding sweet tea in the store so thrilled to find at Amazon at a reasonable price.

Casey Snowdeni is an eleven year boy living with his divorced farther and grandfather at a New Jersey based umpire school (the third best in the country out of three.) Casey loves this school.Though this school they make their living. Are a close knit unit and Casey has deep devotion to both the school and the family.His true ambition is to be a reporter and begins to work at the school newspaper and develops a story that both shows him his weaknesses and a moral dilemma. To report the story he must report the hurtful truth or bend the facts to spare his emotions but not his developing ethics.The humorous element is his best friend Zeke, a lovely, strong friendship . Zeke, is classic and enjoyable.The underlying plot between Casey and his divorced mother was moralistic but soft threaded and not fully explored.SCREAMING AT THE UMP was an enormously enjoyable read and I breezed thru it. Most gratifying was the abscents of sex and foul language. (Not being a prude- I loves reading a truely age appropriate book)I found it a fun and pleasurable read, baseball, relationships and appropriate antics.Recommend .Age group: 8-11

You get a LOT of good quality yarn here which I use for journaling and looming bracelets and trims.Buying this in bulk with so many colors without trekking around was a good option for me. This supply is going to last me a good long while.What I can't say is if was a good deal? I've picked up these spools at thrifts shops for cents on the dollar but it would take me a while to obtain this kind of collection that way.

This has quickly become my favorite reading lamp.First what I like is the USB charger and power bank, I plug it in every morning and I'm good to go at bedtime but I'm quite sure --bordering on positive-- this would last three night without being charged.Bonus, genius...you can install batteries, which is what I think I'm going to do for travel.Lots and lots of light but compared to my bedside reading lamp this is way more functional. Perfect amount of light for me, and the gooseneck allows you to position it if the light is too much.It is top heavy, which is not a problem for my kindle or a hardback but a mass market paperback would be tough. I clip it on to the side of my nightstand, I know that won't work for everyone....but even the side of a drawer with the light in the right position works.Really happy with this.Will update review should product show flaws.

As a none knitter I've come to love looming and I thought this loom would be a great and quicker way to make afghans. I was wrong. I've been working on my first on for months.The best thing is when finished (when I get there) I'll have one complete pie  that doesn't have to be sewn together.The rest are cons but not negatives unless you let them be.It's a heavy awkward piece to work with in your lap, well, I've managed to deal with this it's really more in my mind an odd challenge. The real negative is looming on it around the bends, it's uncomfortable and time consuming.I loop an entire row purling over every 15th or 20th so the row stays in place. I work on it when I want and I'm getting a smoother product. It may take months but crafting can be like that.(I'd probably look into different versions of a wide loom, one without so many inner circles)
Son is heading to Ohio State, it's his shirt of the summer, been washed way too many times and still holding up better than it has a right too.Fits as expected.

Theses are fun, trendy and comfortable. I'm a size 7 and the large really fits perfectly. The color is a lovely sea foam blue and grey. They really are summer show stoppers.They price is great for a Calvin Klien shoe, the price isn't so great considering the entire shoe is made od high dentistry foam. That was a bit disappointing.Still, I really like them, I've worn them quite a bit and their holding up so they're not giving off signals of being one bit fragile.

I really can't say how durable they are until they're really used come the school year but overall there seems to be a tad more flexibility meaning they'll probably fit in backpacks better.1" binders are necessary evils come September and these are pretty standard.UPDATE: this held up very well and are in good (though graffitied!) shape for next year. Shocked! They made it through a year of High School!

My husband thought this was the most foolish item...he obviously hasn't destroyed numerous hangers by the sheer weight of many scarves.This substantial hanger (metal) is bearing up nicely. It does the trick. It works.It will hold different amounts depending on the thickness of the variety and how neatly you fold them. I keep at least 15/17 on here with no sagging, no giant heaps of cloth on the closet floor.So NOT a foolish item!

These rubber finger tips are obviously great for sorting paper but they are terrific for sewing and looming. They give you a grip but they reduce the fatigue and wear on your fingers with certain projects. I love them!They're also a creative tool for scrapbooking and journaling. You can create some interesting textures and designs with inks and paint. (And they clean up easily with soap and water.)

CeraVe Diaper Rash Cream is just great skin care. With three essential ceramides each providing a different element to create a luxury and practical skin cream.I particularly like it as a hand cream and a little goes a long way. As someone who repeatedly has to wash their hands through out the day CeraVe Diaper Rash Cream has become a product I don't have to continually reapply.It is nowhere near as thick as ordinary cream of this nature which is what makes it a particularly good hand cream.It's also very effective for dry patches of skin...though I love Aquaphor and find it quite effective, it's greasy. This isn't so it's perfect for daily application.This is so just not for diaper rash!
I no longer use lids, just these, unless you've forgotten about your pan completely they never boil over.I have 10 and 12 inch covers. Foolproof, love them.

The suit fit perfectly, it fit exactly to size, for once I didn't have to size up for a bathing suit.One reviewer stated this doesn't really keep the prostheses in place...half true. The insert pocket is on the side and large, no struggling to place it...I simply took black thread (doubled) and overlapped a dozen stitches. Perfect.At this price I was thrilled to do it. Easy fix.Recent comment: I've just noticed the price increased, for this reason I'd probably head back to Lady Grace ( free alterations) where they make it much easier to deal my insurance company...survivors get to write these off and at $74 this is no longer the bargain it was.What a shame.For this reason I'm changing to a three star review since  the price was a factor.

I'm not deducting stars but probably the worst thing about this revamped Polaroid is the price of the film.It's a delightful camera which of course brings lots of memories for those of us of a certain age. Imagine once again loading film into a camera?It's a very simple camera to use, setting it up is easy --insert batteries, insert film, set your setting (indoor, outdoor, ) take your shot.This is not your everyday camera. We've used this on Girls Nites, (loads of fun that), family gatherings and vacations for fun moments. It always generates a buzz.My teens think it's a blast.I love the instant photos for craft projects, bulletin boards, messages.....CLEAN YOUR ROOM!I just have to keep enough film around....film bundles are the best options.This would be a great graduation gift.Welcome back Polaroid!

This is a nice weight poly blend with the feel of rayon. It washes very well and the colors are bright and elongating due to the chevron pattern. It's a great length front and back and fits exactly like a tunic should billowy not boxy. Perfect with leggings.
It's  a Perfect length both front and back (I picked up two colors), it's billowy without being boxy and just right for leggings. Average department store quality.Happy with this purchase.

What begins as an assignment in Laurel's English class (Write a Letter to a Dead Person) becomes a way for her to come to terms with the death of her sister, the separation of her parents and other deep issues.Written in a chain of letters to dead celebrities starting with Kurt Cobain because her sister May loved him, his music meant something to her, and he died young, to River Phoenix whom they both loved in STAND BY ME, Amelia Earhart, Amy Winehouse, Judy Garland, Jim Morrison, are other luminaries she identity's her struggles with.It's touching, sweet, distorted, tortured and original. Laurel delves deep, conveying and sharing much in her letters, letters which allow her to cope with her past and deal with her present. A truly moving novel.

Really this is a 4/12 review -- I'm withholding that 1/2 star since they haven't been washed more than once so I can't verify how they'll hold up.( I'm thinking pretty good, having seen my fair share of clunkers)They really are good quality for the price point. I bought two sets. My 18 year old is quite happy with them, soft, not stiff or scratchy and def not poor quality.This is a purchase I'm happy with. The white is a white with a hint of grey undertones meaning - not blinding pure, and not yellow undertones. Nice. The navy is classic and true.If I don't update my review then please note that means these are holding up nicely with numerous washes.I'm not expected to be disappointed.

I love this product...truth be told on a regular basis I prefer the Powerade Zero due to the decrease in sugar.Still, as a change of pace this was great! And...it's a terrific product, one recommended by Dr (as was any power drink) to keep up my electrolytes etc.The Mountain Berry is good. I like it but I think all favors are subjective.Even with the sugar I don't find this a sweet drink...though as a dental hygienist I would recommend against any sugared fluided coating your teeth on a regular basis.What I would LOVE is if this (or the ZERO) were offered on a subscription and save program. I would dearly love to have this delivered in quantity.And for an eight count....what a super price!

I think these are great! They don't match my decor so I took them to work where they are terrific for supersize coffee and tea, soup ( which we rarely make) but nice for salads especially when we're sharing.Bright, pretty and solid these are winners!

The Lincoln Myth is another thriller in Berry's Cotton Malone seriesThe hunt is on to save dueling secrets from Abraham Lincoln and Brigham Young that could have serious effects on the U.S as a nation.Both of the covert document have been passed down from president and Mormon Prophet for decades the plot is all about finding the missing pieces to reach the ultimate goal: a states right to secession.All very interesting but at times it read more like a dull history lesson with pages of legal script weighing down the pace of the story.While I'm a fan of Berry since The Amber Room this was lacking the usual spirit and action found in his work.Absolutely worth reading, just don't expect the same punch.

This is a great deal for a top of the line product. At our office this is the 'Cadillac' version of power toothbrushing. One for this price is amazing, two is out of this world.The heads move at a rapid, controlled speed (no more toothbrush abrasion!) which provides a highly significant removal of plaque.The timer will alert you when to move on from one quadrant to the next. Using it for the full two minutes is key!The travel case is a great bonus, charge it and go, it should stay charged for at least five days if not longer so most of the time there is no need to take the charger with you.It's important to know with power toothbrushes to get the best life span from them ( the only problem I've had is when I dropped it onto a tile floor) is to charge fully, then unplug the unit. You'll know when it's time to charge -- there's not a significant difference in the movement of the head but you will notice its a tad slower. I've had various versions of Oral-Bs for many years.It's a great product,  built to last. Recommend!

This fit, they're comfortable after a day at work, color is spot on and I'm in love with the slight heel.They're really everything you could hope for if your profession requires you to be on your feet.Winners!

The Set Up Man is T.T.Monday's debut novel and pun intended, he hits a homerun.Johnny Adcock is a relief pitcher for the San Jose Bay Dogs with a side job as a private investigator, granted most, perhaps all of the jobs have to do with investigating his teammates and other players in MLB.Cheating wives and finances are his specialty although this time out he's stumbled upon a murder investigation when his current client (catcher Herrera) comes to him for both a standard job yet one that becomes increasingly more complex.The story has some unexpected turns and has the potential to turn into an enjoyable series, Monday has created a nicely flawed main character.The baseball background is well done, informative and interesting but in no way overwhelms the plot, it enhances it. I actually enjoyed this detail -- it was well done and added a different element.Monday has also created great side characters.So treat yourself to this little gem with a lot of plot, heart, detail, action and a really good read!Hope the Bay Dogs and Adcock stick around!
breaks apart easily. good thing they send 5 maybe that's why. each one lasts about 6 months before falling apart.
well they do work as advertised. a little hard to get the cubes out. Thought they would work a little better.
perfect size - we use it in the kitchen for odds and ends. really like it.
pretty glasses. thought I would like them better than I do. They're OK but I'm not madly in love with them.

way too hard to configure. proprietary BS software. And if the backup goes awry, you lose your data since it's encrypted using their proprietary system. things they don't tell you on their marketing materials.
great scale i love the backlit function and I also love that it does digital and analog together. Not expensive and works beautifully.
excellent, no slip, high quality, easy to wash outside with a hose
excellent, no slip, high quality, easy to wash outside with a hose
these are the best acidophilus I've found and the price on Amazon is 1/2 what it is in the natural grocery store near me
excellent quality. dries really fast and my kids like the glowing red lights - like a spaceship!
Don't notice any effect at all.

Much taller than I expected. Really keeps things hot for a long time. Base is too wide to fit in my car's cup holder (but that could just be my car). Lid is a bit tricky to clean - wash by hand, not in dishwasher.
as expected, a high quality, low cost fan. wish there was an easier way to open them to clean them, rather than all the screws in the back.

junk. ink dried out after 3 weeks. thank goodness I made the return deadline. every time I try a non-Epson ink, this type of thing happens. Going back to real Epson ink (sadly, because it's not cheap). But I need ink that works!

Really wanted to like it, but the trackpad was horrible - unusable. I actually think it was defective. It wouldn't pickup my finger, then it would act like it was trying to attach to my finger movement. Yes, I tried all the settings and I'm a tech nerd so I know what I'm doing to configure a trackpad.  No dice. This machine also really needs a backlit keyboard in a major way. The weight wasn't too bad. The screen was great. The audio was worse than I expected - just average. And this is a regular HDD so it was on the slower side. This was a $700 laptop that should be going for about $400. Better machines on the market for this price.
Meh. Not very exciting. And the price is a LOT More than it is worth. We found a $8 case that works 1000x better. Needs more attention to detail.

Kickstand is so flimsy, this thing will fall apart if it gets knocked around, something falls on it, or you are careless. Needs to go back to the drawing board. I did like that it gave you 2 different angles to watch movies, depending on which way you used the kickstand. Still the kickstand was so cheap, it had to go back. It would not have lasted a month.
Does the job. Great value. Need to wash with vinegar/baking soda when it first arrives to get the smell out. Cool blue light too.

Awesome router. Works better than a Netgear one I have with the same specs.  Looks kinda weird. Only thing I wish I could change: where the wires go in the back (ethernet, power, LAN, etc.), you cannot maneuver around the metal base/stand in the back so it actually gets in the way. They should change the design a bit.
Great design. Sturdy, stylish, works well.

a little too sweet for me, and it still has that kind of metallic aftertaste that some stevia products have. It's true you only need the tip of a fingernail amount. I just don't care for the aftertaste.

looks great! very sturdy construction. We hired an electrician to install them (a great suggestion BTW - unless you're a handyman type yourself). Looks really nice in our dining room over a big table - the wood on the blades matches the table.

fantastic LED bulbs at a good price. We installed these in regular old-fashioned kitchen spotlights that were sucking up an enormous 60W per bulb. With 12 of these new LED lamps taking only 6W per bulb, we're able to operate 10 lamps for the cost of one. We were always in the kitchen, so having 720W of lighting on almost constantly was a huge drain on the electric bill. We've had these for several months and honestly they seem to have had a noticeable effect on lowering our electric bill (hard so say how much but maybe $10-15/month less now).
beautiful lamp, good quality construction, works well with CFL bulbs

nice phone! i really love the big numbers - you don't have to squint to see which number you are dialing. the cordless phone works well too - great call quality. pleased that this dual phone system was affordable. I have it connected to Ooma Business as our office phone and it works perfectly (tho I did have to go buy a 50 foot old fashioned phone cable). Still, small inconvenience for this setup.

Wow, nice, fast drive. Very cute little guy. I was concerned that the drive would be too heavy/awkward hanging out of the laptop but what you don't see/read in the descriptions is that this drive comes with a very wide cable, meaning the cable is about 1/4 inch wide. Therefore the drive can literally hang out of your laptop while the laptop is elevated with little to no wear or stress on the connector or cable. That is a bonus that is hard to anticipate pre-purchase. Files load on here incredibly rapidly as well.

very good quality cable. I thought they were a bit spendy, but they work really well. I appreciate the cord being coiled so it takes less space. I use it with the 1byone USB car charger and together they work beautifully to charge my phone in the car.

Pleasantly surprised.  Good quality construction. I like the red band because it draws your eyes there when looking where to put in the USB connector. And it does charge my phone in the car really fast.

UPDATE JULY 3, 2015:I ended up buying the laptop from HP directly - cheaper than on Amazon plus you get the full HP warranty directly. The issue with the keyboard I mentioned below is not that big of a deal. First, you can turn on and off the backlighting (F5 key). Second, the letters are a dark gray, not white, on my machine. They are also transparent so when you turn on the backlighting you can actually see through them. I was also wishing for a black machine, but I really like this metal one. It reminds me of a Mac Air I had a couple years ago. The PC is extremely well built. Very solid. And it's very fast - better than the 4th gen i7 laptop it's replacing (with the same RAM). Boot up is also noticely faster than my prior i7 SSD (it was a Lenovo) (6 seconds with this machine vs about 15 for the Lenovo). The only criticism i have is where the power cord attaches into the socket. The jack is at an angle and it's hard to get it to stay firmly in the power out hole. It says mostly in, but wiggles out often. Not major. Still, this is the best laptop on the market right now. Oh, did i mention the screen? Great colors!PREVIOUS REVIEW:I was looking forward to purchasing this as my next laptop. I was really, really looking forward to it. Everything - almost - about it was perfect: the SSD, good screen, folding screen, etc. I went to see the laptop in person at a computer store and that's when I was devastated: the keyboard was unusable - and here's why. The characters on the keyboard are written in white. That's gray paint on silver keys. The silver keys are surrounded by a backlight from the LED lights underneath. So basically you are entirely unable to discern which keys are which on the keyboard. On the model I saw in the store, the keys were already being worn down so what I was starting to see was a day when you would have 100 silver keys on a keyboard and have no ability to figure out which key went where. This is one of those stupid mistakes that never should have happened. If this laptop had a normal black keyboard like the Dell or Lenovo models, I would have bought it without hesitation. Shame.UPDATE 5 June 2015:I have since discovered that one can purchase silicone keyboard overlays for less than US$10 that will fit this laptop. OK that's a great workaround but really HP? You didn't think this through.

Second card I've had in 2 years and both failed. On the first card, the connector grooves broke apart. For the second card, the card suddenly wouldn't let me write to or copy from it, then all of a sudden it needed to be reformatted - with all my data on it! Lexar replaced the cards but what about all the data I lost - both times. Cannot trust a Lexar SD card anymore.  To be clear, these cards were used only with light use. They were cared for in protected sleeves when not in use. They were used 1-2x per week. I always clicked on stop the drive before removing from the SD card slot. These cards were not abused or mishandled. There is a fundamental design flaw that causes them to break down prematurely. Avoid.

I cannot believe what a difference quality pillows make when sleeping. I feel like I am sleeping on a cloud. We also tested another brand of pillows in the same order, and they were also excellent (see my other reviews).

I don't think this technology is ready for the market yet. The marker didn't work, nevermind the fact that no instructions were included. So I did what I assumed I should do. It plugged in fine, but never worked, not once, showing the big beautiful color words you see in the photo.

I was impressed when unpacking it. I thought, this looks great. Build felt nice, etc. First, let me say that I was only able to use this computer 2 days before I got a "bootable drive not found" error that fully prevented rebooting and I had to return the machine. Luckily all data was backed up in the cloud or I would not have been happy. At all.My first problem is the crapware that was loaded onto the PC. Acer insists to include its AbCloud tools so that you can store your music, pictures and documents in the cloud. Oh, you mean like dropbox. I wish PC manufacturers would quit trying to be clever and spend valuable development resources inventing something that already exists and works so well - oh, and dropbox is free too.The keyboard layout is wonky. The up and down arrows are tiny little things that you could easily mis-press an adjacent key. The delete button is a massive square which is kind of nice. To get page up or page down, you have to use an alt+ function - not nice.The screen quality is just OK. even at the 1920 x .... resolution, it just doesn't seem as sharp as it should. Once I figured out how to turn off the adaptive brightness (dims screen because it knows better than you), then the screen was bright enough. But everything on the screen - like the program icons were all grainy. This shouldn't happen.Oh, Acer has a bunch of other programs - something like 10 to 15 programs and you have to go hunting to find what you want to change. Very awkward. Why not put all software tools in one, nice, tidy Acer console. Nope. Instead, the first screen page in Add/Remove programs is full of Acer junk.The easel/hinge situation seemed fine. The tablet mode was also nice. The PC is definitely lightweight, which was also nice. And the speakers/sound quality was excellent, much better than I expected.In summary, Acer could have a great machine if it solved the clunkware issue, redesigned the keyboard (hint: look at Lenovo's keyboards), and improved the screen graininess, especially at the high resolution the system offers. I'll keep my eyes open for the R 13.5 instead. Ultimately, it was the fun "bootable drive not found" error that sent the machine back. I mean, really?

I wasn't sure whether I'd like this carry-on suitcase but I took a chance, given Amazon's nice return policy. The carry-on turned out to be fantastic. Very well made, and a very good design. I took it on a series of international flights with me and it always fit in the overhead compartment and under some seats (if there was not an obstruction in the way - like a power box under the seat in front of you). It's true what the other reviews say - the lock is kind of silly - someone could just get in from the front side. But since when has a suitcase lock ever kept anyone out of a suitcase? They'd just steal your whole bag, right? I also wasn't sure about the red color, but honestly I really like it. Distinctive, and it's not too bright or shiny - just right for me.

Television networks seem hell bent on replacing good shows with, shall we say, not so good shows. A lot of great shows have bit the dust unnecessarily. This show is simply just OK and I'm upset that better shows were cleared out for this one. The story premise is good but it's too much of Halle Berry running around worried "where's my baby".  I'm surprised that Halle Berry took this role. And if she wasn't the main character, this show would fall apart. If Season 2 doesn't come, I really wouldn't care at all. And I do love sci-fi, thrillers and so on. Writers: back to the drawing board.
works very well. and affordable. strong bags and a good size
excellent USB stick to put on your keychain. for those times you need to transfer a low GB of files - like a movie to a friend or a presentation for work.

How can you really tell if it is effective? That's something that is very hard to measure. The devices are nice and convenient and only cover up one power outlet, which is nice. One thing I HATE is the flashing blue light to let you know the device is working. The shade of blue is nice, but at night when you are trying to sleep, it looks like a disco with three of these things flashing away. We put black tape over the blue lights. if the put the light behind the panel (so it was indirect) flashing, it would be much better. We have 2 dogs and these do not seem to bother them at all. The set of 3 is nice and it's not expensive so may be worth a try.

excellent set of headphones. affordable but not cheap. I bought these to take on the plane with me to listen to movies. I bought this version with the 3.5 mm jack and not the USB plug, then I bought a separate USB plug that I can plug these 3.5 mm jacks into. The reason I did this is sometimes USB plugs stick out too far or are too firm and could break the USB plug itself. Anyway, the sound is crystal clear, both for incoming audio and for transmitting my voice via the mic. My only pet peeve with this device is that the mic does not retransmit the sound back to the headphones when you are having a phone call. Therefore, you hear your voice "muffled" because it is over your ears. Not a big deal, but it would be nice. These are also very comfortable. I paid about $25 for these. I also have a $250 pair of Sennheisers. The Sennheisers are very nice, yes and they do retransmit your spoken voice back into the headset. But they're a bit bulkier and very expensive compared to these. These is an outstanding primary or secondary headset and very easy to travel with too.

I didn't believe an electric chainsaw could work. Wow. It absolutely did. Extremely easy to use. No smoke or exhaust from a gasoline powered chainsaw. It cut branches of a pretty hefty size very easily. On a couple branches at weird angles, the chainsaw got stuck - but this happens w/ any chainsaw. You just twist the branch until it frees the saw. I was impressed. And the build quality also seems excellent.

only time will tell of course, but these socks seem great. They held up well on first few wearings. I expect socks to last several years. Previous cotton socks wear out after 6-12 months. These do have something synthetic in them, but if they don't fall apart, that's OK. I'll update the review if that changes.

large size, great price, decent quality - what do you expect for about $25? It saved us from having to spend $65 on a starbuck's to go meeting coffee pack. Whatever. We made great coffee ourselves and put it in this dispenser, and saved $40 on the first use, and we'll continue to save $65 on any future visit to Starbuck's - and have better coffee because we make it outselves!
really like this. sits on my desktop and is a great backup monitor. I like that it is powered by the USB and not requiring a separate power cord. Recommended.

simply did not hold a charge. left in bright direct sunlight for several days, brought in at night, tested charge every day. batteries did not charge, and tried several batteries to be sure it was the charger and not the batteries. tested on a battery tester too and it concurred. no charge was held by any of the batteries.
seemed to make my dogs a little sick, despite using the correct dosage for weight. product seemed to work OK but I might recommend a less powerful product if your dogs are sensitive.

not sure if I didn't get a genuine product or maybe it was old, but this left my hair incredibly greasy as well as small specks/clumps of goo in my hair. the seller (Beautogen) was good about taking it back. I think i'll buy these products locally from now on.

well Tecsun's latest and greatest isn't so great. Couldn't pull in any SW stations, despite using the supplementary antenna cable. I played around for quite a while. too expensive for this not to work easily. though the build quality was excellent. and sound quality for FM stations was also excellent.
and the price is right. hard to find at an affordable price, be careful which size you're buying - it might be a smaller one. check the price per ounce before buying.

can you believe it is so hard to find cheap bean bag refill? this is absolutely adequate, although be careful when opening it. the little balls have an electric charge and will float around the room as you try to pour them out of the bagUPDATE: I bought 2 of these and just spent an entire afternoon cleaning up the crazy little balls all over my driveway (I will try to upload a video of the mess). Not only is this an environmental mess, 1/2 the product floats away (or cannot be removed from the bag due to the static electricity) so it's a poor solution. Get an oversized pillow or find another solution.That said, the vendor was fine and we received it in good shape, and quickly.

0:59 MinsThis fork lift came in a very nice displayed box, and in it came a fork lift, a plastic pallet, a oil drum, rechargable battery pack, and a remote control.  The fork lift is made of high quality material, all the details this toy is very well precise.This fork lift packs with power and fun, it takes a bit of practice to control it.  Especially, when you have to use the fork lift to get underneath the pallet and lift it up.  I know my son will go crazy when he see this toy (It will be his Christmas present), because me and my husband had so much fun testing it out.The remote control will take sometimes to get use too and this is also a minus on this toy because on the remote control, there is a side to side button yet it's just there, it doesn't work.  (Not a defected item, just how it's made) On both sides, only the up and down buttons work, and you have to use both of them (from both sides) to control the fork lift.All in all, this fork lift has real nice well detailed design, fun to play with and itis very powerful as well.  I got this product at a discounted price for product testing purpose and this is my honest and unbiased review.

My son loves bath times like most kids, he would stays in the bathtub as long as you let him and every time you tell him it's time to get out, he would say "One more minutes" lol.  Anyways, the toys he has in there were given to him two years ago and I have been meaning to buy him new ones.  When I came across these toys, they just so cute so I decided to get them for him.As you can see in the pictures, these came in three cars, one plane, one helicopter, one train, two boats, one cano, and one submarine.  Now, as I opened the box, I only allowed him to get three at a time, but he kept begging so I gave in and gave him all ten of them.  We told him that he can play with the toys during bath time, but he couldn't care less about which toys for bath or not, he just carry them around all the times.His favorite is the submarine, he loves submarine because he saw it from the show "Dinosaur Train", and this is the first submarine toy he own and it squeaks.  The submarine is the only one the squeaks in this set so not too worry parents,  I know, as a mom, I try to avoid toys that makes too much noise.These toys' quality are high, they are made of high quality rubber and the painting are well detailed and the colors are vibrant and well designed.The packaging looks very professional and look fancy.My son loves them and he had so much fun playing with them during bath time, and non bath time and even sleep time. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

1:02 MinsI've always been wanting a drone for my son, I think it would be fun for him and the pet chasing it around.  However, with a 2 years old, I don't want to buy an expensive one because I know it will get destroyed real fast.  So while looking for an affordable one, I was lucky enough to tumble on this Top Race Mini Drone.This is a great starter drone for first time owner to practice on and lots of fun to play with, it's very unique because you can have it rolls around, running around the floor, or fly up high and do tricks.  However, the only trick I know right now is to fly it up high and crash.The good thing about this mini drone is it's very durable.  When I opened the box, and saw how small it was my thought at that moment was it wouldn't last long.  All the parts of the drone feel so flimsy and fragile, I didn't dare hold it too hard, but after playing with it, crashing it many many times, it still works great.The battery last a while too, we can play with it for good 10 minutes before we have to charge it again.The only thing I don't like about it is the wheels fall off too easily which make it hard to do fast turns on the floor.  To switch the wheels and the protective case out, you have to be very careful, take your time and do it in a good lighting area.My son loves it, the cat tries to catch it, and the dog just ignores it, but we all had fun playing with it.  I am trying to master my skills in controlling it so we can do some awesome tricks to it.I received this Mini-Drone for free of charge for product testing purpose and this is my honest review and experience with this drone.
