Maybe it's inexpensive because the bowl is plastic where some other units have glass bowls. These don't break,  have not discolored and are very easy to clean. (We usually hand clean the parts although the manufacturer says they are dishwasher safe on the top rack.)If it works for another six months we will certainly replace it with another one just like it!

Our original Petmate, now several years old, developed a leak so we decided to replace it (although we might have repaired it). This new one seems a much better design. The opening in the mouth of the bottle is large enough to get a cleaning brush into, the  old one was not. This one has a carbon filter built in, we use R. O. filtered water but an additional filter is a plus. The bottle latches positively on the base preventing it from falling off. Microban is built into the base. That should also provide some semi-permanent anti-bacterial protection. It holds a reasonable amount of water for our dog, any more and it would be too heavy, any less and it would require cleaning and refilling too frequently.

We love this Kindle. I had purchased a new one for my wife over a year ago and she uses it continually. I was content to get by with my original Kindle in spite of the superiority of the new design until Amazon offered this reconditioned one. I couldn't resist the price, so I ordered one! It was delivered packaged just like a new one. I could not tell it from new. I also use mine continually and it works like new. I was afraid the WI-fi would not load as fast as the Wispernet of the original but after loading several large books, I'm satisfied the download speed is quite comparable.

The face is very nice, the numbers are easy to read, the date (even with the magnified window) is not. The style is modern and formal enough for evening wear. The band is attractive and simple enough to adjust. The light powered feature is worth a lot. So far the watch keeps accurate time.

We ordered this 5# Anthony's almond flour and 5# Honeyville almond meal at the same time to determine which of the two produces better results in our Paleo recipes. We had heard that both were good products. We could not determine that one was better than the other. They had the same texture, flavor, color and density. Almond bread was excellent with either as were almond cookies, muffins, and several other recipes that contained almond flour.We hope this sample was typical of both products so that in the future we will order the one with the lowest cost (and expect good results)!

I like cargo pants they are comfortable and hold all of the various items I carry while doing various chores around our property. These are no exception. they are a very nice design. Although I hesitated buying them sight unseen, they seem well made. I like the colors (grey and blue), they have been stable so far through several washings.

In Aug 2008, I ordered a Large Squirrel from Amazon. This squirrel had gotten filthy but both "squeakers" still worked and the squirrel was still in one piece.  We were afraid to wash it for fear of ruining the squeakers, Our Miniature Schnauzer had never tired of playing with it, so I wanted to reward him with a new one. Unfortunately, I could not reorder the identical squirrel as it is no longer available.I ordered this one as the description was similar to the original. This squirrel is not as realistic looking as the original, but it appears to be made of durable materials. It also had two squeakers, however, the body squeaker quit working the first day we had it. Our dog plays with it but we are disappointed the body squeaker has quit so soon. That takes away a lot of its "play" value. We almost wish we had kept the old one and tried to clean it!
Although the size is specified, they are smaller than expected. The quality is below our other bathroom rugs and they look dirty even though they are not!.
For my application I wish I could have bought one 12' long but this one works okay. I'm impressed with the overall quality and expect it to last for several years
This surge suppressor is an unobtrusive, inexpensive, plug-in unit that should provide a degree of protection to my AV equipment.
These copper tinned lugs are high quality. They solder easily and the hole size fits my battery post correctly. Like so many things these days they are a bit pricy.

These are good cable joiners, particularly useful when temporarily inserting a signal meter as in setting up a satellite system for an RV. (that I do whenever we camp). Some joiners include nuts, useful for mounting them on a panel. If you need the nuts you must look elsewhere, they are not included.

This is a good way to consolidate all of the power leads from an AV system. It protects from an external overload. To complete the job it should be plugged onto a surge protector, (I bought one here on Amazon), then into house power.

The selected arias are not always my favorite from the opera and many of the artists and orchestras are somewhat obscure (at least to me). However, they are all quite talented, have beautiful voices and make the listening experience quite satisfying!

I bought my hose reel from Home Depot during a sale for half the price of this one. The model numbers are slightly different but from the picture they look identical except mine does not have a storage bin. This is my second reel, both rated at 225' of 5/8" hose. I have had the original for several years and it still works. However the handle (to move the reel about) has broken several times and I am no longer able to repair it, so I have installed it on my deck where it is useful for cleaning but no longer has to be moved.The handle on the new one has been redesigned and appears to be stronger than the previous one, however, I will be more careful and treat it more gently especially when moving it across rough ground with a full load of hose! It reels smoothly, does not leak and appears to be made of reasonably high quality plastic. I expect it to last for several years.

I took a chance that the interface of this sprinkler head was compatible with my Scarecrow. The original sprinkler head that was supplied with the Scarecrow (and came apart after several years of use), had a little different sealing method than the Rain Bird, but the Scarecrow's mounting port appeared to be universal, so I ordered the Rain Bird. It works, in fact, it's adjustments make it so much more versatile than the original that it adds to the effectiveness of the Scarecrow.

This sound bar has a single analog input only, therefore, it is plug-and play only with TVs equipped with a headphone jack or an analog audio output. It's probably not cost effective to convert TVs with digital output only to function with this sound bar.It is designed to be used with 40" TV's, its width matches, and it can sit unobtrusively underneath. We use it with a 32" TV mounted in a 42" wide cabinet. The sound bar fits nicely on top of the cabinet. Stereo separation is improved over a 32" sound bar.Audio is definitely improved over the TV's built-in speakers. No specifications are given, but the frequency band seems reasonably wide with low distortion. I have not measured it to date, but I seriously doubt if it effectively reproduces frequencies below about 100 Hz. (Bass frequencies are not its forte!)There are some features that are a bit unusual for a sound bar in this price range. It uses a standard Sony code so that it may be programmed with other controllers such as the DirecTV controller. However, if the power is not turned off at the controller, the unit senses when no signal is present and after a few minutes turns itself off (it turns itself on in a few seconds after receiving a signal from the TV) so that no programming is actually required. All things considered, this is a pretty good unit at a very good price.

Great sticky tape for things that don't like to stick together. I do encaustic wax art on glossy paper. No glue I've tried will stick that paper to matt board. It just pops off. This tape is the only thing that works.

Love this stuff. I am using it to extend the season here in the hills of SW VA. I have it on hoops over my broccoli and kale. Have has several frosts already and it is doing great. Allows water and air to enter which is a plus over another kind that I had. Very sturdy material that resists tearing.

Wonderful light! Slim and lightweight with hanging hooks that are removable and adjustable. This also has a magnetic clip that is removable allowing you to attach this to metal objects like a car hood or a metal work cabinet.  Runs on a rechargeable battery so there is no need for cords. Invaluable for someone working on a car in the dead of night. Very handy wherever you need that extra bit of light for fine work.

I really wanted to like these socks for my yoga class. I have a rather small foot though and by the end of the class they were pretty stretched out and the sticky gripper part wasn't on the bottom anymore. They would probably be fine for someone with a larger foot.Update: I have worn one pair of these 3 times and they already have a hole in the heel.

So far I am fairly impressed with this little gadget. It really does work once you get it set up. Getting set up was a bit of an issue. The Jawbone device didn't want to pair with my phone at first. Finally they mated up and all was well. I would like to see some better instructions included with this. Not everyone is a 20 something tech whiz and you can't get any instruction until you get paired. I would also like some actual insights included on how tight this has to be on your wrist, is it waterproof etc. I finally went to the sight to find out about the waterproof thing.I found this very hard to put on. In fact I can't do it myself. Once you have it on, you surely want to leave it on. It is very stylish. It seems to count steps very well and it is easy to check your progress. This really beats wearing a pedometer and trying to keep track of it all day or have it not register or fall off.The sleep tracker is pretty nifty although I am somewhat skeptical that it is really right. It registers light sleep if you are a restless sleeper, which I am.All in all, I think for the money it is a good device for tracking your movements and helping to get those 10,000 steps that we all need.

These placemats are fabulous. I have some similar to these and they are terrific for everyday use. So easy to clean. They look like a woven fiber, but are actually PVC material. Just wipe them off and they are fine. If someone really makes a mess, I roll them up and swish them around in warm soapy water, rinse and dry and they are like new. I've had mats like these in the past that were actual fiber and they are impossible. They curl and stretch and warp. These are terrific!

An amazing piece of work!! I got this for our weekly kombucha refill at the farmers market. The glass jugs they use are fragile and this is a perfect solution to the problem Unbreakable, seals superbly. This is made for the ages and I am thrilled to have gotten it.  Wonderfully balanced for pouring.  A straight, pure five stars on this product!

A very stylish design is the first thing you notice about this chair. The second thing is that it is very sturdy and well made. Easy to assemble. Nicely padded cushion. It matches very well in my new kitchen and we just might buy another to have two. It is kind of large and we don't have much overhang on our counter.What I am not too fond of is that the seat is big from front to back. I have short legs and if I set against the back I can't reach the rest at the bottom. This makes it very difficult to swivel because the swivel seat on this is stiff.The back is also I think, tilted too far back at a kind of leaning angle. At first I thought it was assembled wrong, but it is designed that way with a bit of backward lean.  Not great if you have teens or husbands that insist on leaning way back in their chairs. This is an accident waiting to happen.

We've been taking this for several months now. I have fibromyalgia and my husband has arthritis pain. So far it is really helping him with no problems. It seems to be working for me as well, but I think it is starting to bother my stomach so I may have to stop taking it.  One of the few supplements that have been recommended to me that actually seem to work.

Fabulous camera. This is a lot better than the other camera we currently have. Takes really clear pictures and works quite well. I like the tripod connection on the bottom. That made it really easy to mount and move around. Our other camera only has a strap and that is a pain sometimes.Only issues were with getting the battery door open to install the batteries. You need to carefully read the instructions, which my husband did not do. :)  We also haven't figured out how to tell how many pictures have been taken via the display, but I think there must be a way.Great camo colors will hopefully keep this camera from being stolen. All in all I would recommend this to anyone wanting a good wildlife camera.

We have a problem getting any decent olive oil where we live. I thought I would try this. It is OK, but seems very strong to me as if it had been stored in heat. Not good for dipping bread for sure. OK for cooking. Wish I didn't have 2 tins of it to use.

I didn't think this was on par with the other Event Books. It took me a long time to read as it wasn't truly riveting and I could pretty well guess what was going to happen and the outcome. Quite a departure from the other Golemon books.

I am always looking for alternative cooking platforms. We do a lot of entertaining and run a bed and breakfast sometimes. This grill has some good points and some bad.Pros:Easy to clean by hand washing. The finish is very non stick.The splatter guard, while difficult to install does work fairly well.Heats pretty evenly, with a few cold spots at the edges.Cons:Has a large counter foot print, but the cooking space is really only enough for 2 or 3 servings. I made a breakfast on it to try it out. Got 8 short strips of bacon on the grill side and 4 small eggs on the griddle part.No real guidelines on regulating the temperature. You just have to stand by and fiddle with it as needed.No clear instructions on installing the splatter guard, or for that matter even what that piece is used for. Be sure to pay great attention to unpacking this to get all the coverings and cardboard out of it before you heat it up.All in all, this is functional. It will see very sporadic use in our household of 2 and I'm not sure the storage space is going to be worth it. In my opinion this would be great for a dorm room or a small apartment with no other cooking space. I suppose if you eat a daily diet of chicken breasts it would be useful, but we tend to more sophisticated fare here.

Wonderful upgrade to these cups. They do not crack at all. Believe me I put one through it's paces. Had it crushed and twisted and then filled it with water. Not a leak or a crack anywhere. I used to save the old ones and reuse them to start seedlings and cuttings in. It was always a pain because if you picked them up the wrong way the would split along the sides. These are super durable and easy to hold on to when wet.

I'll be honest. I really didn't expect this light to be anything special because of the Black and Decker name. I WAS WRONG! This is a very nicely made LED light stand with a USB charger on the front. I just finished using it on my drawing table in my studio to replace an Ott light that I had. I didn't realize how much I was working in the dark until now.  Very clear, good light without any eyestrain problems.  It has a small footprint and a long cord so it can go anywhere. Nice, heavy base. Multiple positions and unlike my Ott light it actually stays in the position you put it in. There is an Allen wrench included if you need to tighten the joints. All in all I am very impressed and will use this whenever I draw.The directions are a bit sketchy I thought and I have absolutely no idea what purpose the little wire loop at the end of the light serves.

These are tough gloves! I was skeptical about the fit because I have a small hand, but the mediums are absolutely fine. I wear these a lot doing polymer clay and painting.  These are easy to get on and the cuffs are strong. Sometimes when you pull on these kinds of gloves, you poke a finger right through the side or pull the cuff loose right off the bat. Not these. They are well made.

Rarely do I see mainstream costume jewelry that is well made and as beautiful as this watch is. Stunning detail in every facet of the band, the face, the back and the clasp. It was even actually set at the right time for me and running when I opened the box.  Easy to read numbers. Instructions on how to adjust the band without taking it to a jeweler. Lovely presentation case. This watch is the complete package. This would be a wonderful gift for a special lady. Can't wait to wear it for a special occasion!

Fabulous cover. I have purchased many outdoor furniture covers over the years and this product is exceptionally well made. Heavy fabric, drawstrings and fasteners. Very durable. I am going to use this to store a vintage wicker chaise lounge for the winter. The cover fits it perfectly and when the strings are drawn in it fits like a glove.

Very informative book on the religion and workings of Islam. Well researched. Rather dry reading as you would expect, but it gives the facts and makes one more aware of the issues this country faces with this religion in the future. It's kind of scary for sure.
Handy gadget for canning. You could easily make one though with a length of dowel and a magnet.
Arrived alive and kicking. The chickens love them. Well packaged for a hot day.

We installed this TV this morning in our den to replace a flat screen that had died. Installation went fairly well, although it wasn't as straightforward as it could have been. I think a lot of manufacturers assume a level of electronic experience that not everyone has. Best advice I can give on that front is to look at a TV you already have and try to follow along with the enclosed instructions.We have satellite where we are, and for some reason the TV wants to do a 30 minute scan for signals. It wouldn't let us override that process, so be prepared.The picture has very vibrant color and clarity. We are watching the Golf Channel at the moment and when they show the ball you can see the blades of grass individually around it.Nice sleek frame and body and it easily attached to the wall bracket we had.The actual listing for this item needs some work as it is very low on specifics. All in all a very nice TV with a fabulous picture.

Bought this based on the reviews and am now rather surprised that it was rated so high. The only thing I like about this ladle is that it hooks to the pan. I just finished canning some Sweet and Spicy Tiger Sauce and had the biggest mess I've ever made. This ladle DOES NOT fill an 8 ounce jar. It overfills it all over the place. It is also difficult to pour out of from the sides. I'll be going back to my old metal ladle and not making such a hot mess.

I've been using this for a few days now and I am really impressed. Used a lot of hand treatments over my lifetime from my nursing days to my landscaping days and now my farming life. This product is pleasingly scented and light, not greasy at all. What I really like is that even after you've washed your hands (which I do a thousand times a day) they still feel like there is a bit of softness and protection still there. I would highly recommend this to anyone that has beat up farm and garden hands.

I am so glad I got this book. Since I have discovered Pomona Pectin, there is no going back to any of the others. These recipes are made specifically to use with this pectin. The end products are better than delicious and they have a very low sugar content. They taste more like fruit spreads than jams or jellies. The absolute best!Been using this for months now and have never had a jam, jelly or spread not set up. I've used organic sugar, honey and maple syrup. Consistent results every time.

These just came yesterday and my Mom and I are having a blast. She is 79 and wanted a streak in her silver hair. We went to the beauty shop and each got one. They lasted 2 days and washed out. A lot of money down the drain. When I saw these chalks I knew I had to try them. For the money they work better than a shop treatment. It is pouring rain right now and I needed to go down to my barn. My hair got wet and the color didn't run or come out.A bit difficult to apply. You need damp hair and a damp chalk. Use a small strand and don't try to do big swatches.My only gripe is the way the sticks are wrapped. They are virtually impossible to open without damaging them.

These canvases are a great value. Twice as many as Micheals for a lot less money. The only place I buy these is Amazon. They work well for acrylics and with the application of watercolor ground, they are fab for inktense pencils and watercolors as well.

I've been doing encaustic art for years. My older version of this iron finally died a painful death from having been dropped on the studio floor one too  many times. I was thrilled to get this from Amazon at a better price than the original iron. Great versatility by being able to remove the handle and us it as a flat, hot surface for smaller art. Holds it temperature well. Good piece of encaustic equipment for a beginner or experienced painter.
These seem to be working well in our phone. Easy to install. Good price. I like having an extra for the next time something dies.

I was a bit skeptical about this stuff. It's got great properties and is a good supplement for people trying to improve their nutrition on the go. Having said all that, I must admit I wasn't brave enough to try it on it's own. I did in fact add it to my morning protein shake and it did not alter the flavor in anyway. This leads me to think that it would be fine on it's own. It is a very small scoop of powder and was easily integrated into my Vega One Chai drink.  I think this is a great way to get more fermented foods into your diet.On the down side, the price point on this is pretty high.
Never worked right on my Kindle. Uninstalled it and redid it to no avail. Because I got a couple of these games I get notifications every day which is really annoying.

Very nice coverlet. As other people have said it is very soft material. Moderately well made.  The fabric pattern is reminiscent of a late 50's early sixties fabric, so this would be lovely for someone doing a retro look room. I guess our bed is just a bit taller than most because this doesn't hang down nearly as long as the picture. I'll need to get a dust ruffle to make it look nice. Very glad to have this for a guest room. Because it is reversible you can limit the floral design if your male household members object.

I got these to trim along the bottom of my electric net fence, and around some raised beds inside the fence. Hold the charge well and cut pretty much anything you need them to. Lightweight and easy to use.

These shears are the BOMB!! I used them tonight to cut up a whole chicken in about 5 minutes.  So much easier than a knife and less wear and tear on my knives. I love that this comes apart for a thorough cleaning. Being Fiskars is a bonus because of their warranty. I have lots of Fiskars products and have occasionally had to get a replacement. They stand by their products. Wonderful!

WOW! This is an awesome piece of equipment. Exceptionally well made. We have a fairly small house and with the long cord I can plug in in the middle of the house and vacuum without having to move the cord. We are on one level, but this would have been very useful in our old house where we had stairs.Pros: Built to last  Extra long cord makes it very easy to get around from room to room.  I love that the vacuum goes with you. No more dragging the machine and bouncing it off walls and furniture.  Extra long extension pole made it easy to get cobwebs in the corners of my high ceilings.  Lightweight enough to wear without getting too heavy. The harness is very adjustable. This seems like an odd thing at first. Wearing a vac on your back, but the mobility of the whole thing is hard to beat.  Mesh bag for accessories that can clip to the harness if you desire, so that everything is right at hand.  The accessories are top quality, commercial grade. I love the floor tool. It has heavy felt ends that stick out from the edges of the metal piece that attaches to the hose. This is just fabulous for cleaning along baseboards and cabinets. No more rub marks or scratches from the ends.  Easily accessible filters.  Cons:  Not many. I have very small hands and the wand is a little thick. It would be nice to have something to hold on to.  My only concern in the construction of this is that the hose just inserts into the top of the vac and into the wand. I can anticipate that over time the connections could get loose causing some separation of the parts. A clip or a screw on connection would be better.All in all, I would take one of these over a Dyson any day of the week.

Been needing one of these that actually works. This spatula has just enough rigidity at the end to be good at flipping all kinds of things. Other silicone turners that I have tried are too flimsy and things stick to easily. Nice handle that won't melt if you rest it on the edge of a pan. Well made.

I used this yesterday or the first time while I was outside gardening. Very handy being able to use one hand for opening. It's  a little harder to get it closed with one hand though. This is well made and easy to clean. Not insulated though, so don't expect your ice not to melt. Easy to attach to a belt loop, although I would recommend a belt instead. With it full, the weight kept pulling my pants down. :0)

Easily mounted and grabs brooms and such with just a push. We are using this in the barn for some tools and shovels and brooms and so far so good. The little hooks that it has are pretty useless and are not intended to hold anything very heavy for sure. They look like an afterthought. You do have to plan out where everything is going to go in advance so that you can make the most of the space.

First let me state for the record that I am not a computer geek. So I won't be reviewing much about Windows 10. I have barely learned to use Windows 8. The one thing I did figure out with 10 is that the start up screen is back and this makes powering off a lot easier.There is almost no informational literature with this item. The consumer is expected to learn everything online on the fly. For some of us older folks that is daunting. I try to stay current, but there is barely enough information with this to even tell you where the power button is.The laptop itself is wonderful. It is light. Only about 1 inch wide at the hinge. This is my third laptop that I've had. One Acer, a Dell and this. I can say that this has the best keyboard of any of my previous laptops. Something about the touch makes you want to type on it. The backlit keys are nice, but they go out with inactivity. This also seems to go to a rest mode quickly, which I'm sure is a setting that could be changed if you are more current than I am. I couldn't figure out how to wake it up without pushing the power button.I really like the touch screen capability. It solves the problem of trying to navigate with the touchpad or a mouse. The screen is vibrant and the battery seems to go for quite a while before charging. Being able to flip the screen to different positions makes this a very fun tablet.Start up was simple once the power button was found. All in all this is a good laptop/tablet for most any use. It is going to take me awhile to figure out all the bells and whistles.

I like these earrings fine. Since the link to the actual product listing is broken I can't speak to the price point of these.  As with most costume jewelry, they look great in the photo. In person they are a bit dead looking. Not a lot of sparkle. The pave seems to have little dead spots in it that don't reflect the light. Otherwise, they are well made, with a stylish shape. These come complete with safety slides on the ear wires. Would be wonderful for a low light situation or evening wear.

I found this bar to be to be tasty and satisfying. The main ingredients are nuts (cashew and almonds, seeds (pumpkin and sunflower), honey, tapioca, and sea salt. A slight mixture of sweet and salty but with unique nutty flavor from the ingredients being the primary flavors. A convenient way to eat your nuts with portion control. A bit expensive for what you get but you will enjoy them.

When I saw the brand I had to try this. This has a nice texture and gives the food you use it with a slight coconut flavor.  It is not only good to cook with but can be used as an excellent moisturizer. It is an organic product that you can actually use beneficially as a food/cooking source or a skin aid. Now that is versatile.

I love coconut water and it is my choice of drink. I also love chocolate. This was not to my liking. The drink is light and organic. To me it was closer to a cocoa drink than chocolate (or maybe a dark chocolate). It left me with an after taste and though I would drink it cold I would rather have a yoo-hoo. I would not purchase; but would drink.

This is a big hit. There are many pieces but none are very small. It is durable enough to handle hours of play and enough parts to keep the interest level high. Even I like changing the front bumpers and giving Lightning a new expression. The choking hazard warning is nothing to really worry about. But their should be a warning on constant car noise and movie dialogue being repeated. This car brings a lot of joy and what more can you ask for in a toy. I do recommend this.

These are many containers of different hand creams in the house but this is now at the top of my list. I have very dry skin and at times my hands can ge so dry that it is painful. This small tube contains cream when it is applied provides immediate relief. It applies smoothly, evenly and is absorbed quickly with no greasy residue. This is a product that I would highly recommend it.

The first edition of this book that I have has the appearance of  a coffee table  book filled with photos. Though there are many photos are a historically relevant and used in appropriate context of the accompanying text. The text itself is far ranging and I would consider a crash course into this period of time in Russia. This is not light reading and worthy of the description of a work in the category of history.Though the material requires much more in depth work a an introduction it covers the period from the imperial rein of the Romanov family at the beginning of the twentieth centaury, through the affects of World War I  and the ensuing turmoil. Russian saw a 1905 revolution, followed by World War I, which gave the opportunity for the armed insurrection in 1917 that was followed by a civil war. Even refers to another separate revolution which is actually part of the civil war.The interactions of all involved parties within Russian and the foreign powers that intervened are covered in these periods of military and political conflict. It is amazing how well these events are analyzed in great detail. The end of the book is a quick summary of all the economic and political turmoil that resulted in the aftermath of the Bolshevik success.

This volume of twenty-five selected hot rods lives up to its title. All the cars within these pages are iconic and many of us will remember them from time trials or magazine covers; and in one case a record album cover. The photography is excellent of these cars giving us a view that is almost as good as having viewed the car at a show. The accompanying text is well written and researched. The history of these car from inception to where they are today is very interesting. This was an informative and enjoyable volume.

Great with rice based meals. But I even experimented on a Sweet and Sour met Loaf and it was a hit; to my surprise. This pre-made mixture was tasty and very convenient. It taste better than some of the sauces I have tried in restaurants. To say the least I was impressed and look forward to trying their other flavors. The product arrived very fast and in a large container. Worth the price.

I am use to working on GM (Chevy, Pontiac, GMC) engines and as far as Ford went in my heyday the big block was the classic Boss engine. I now run a Ford 5.4L SOHC. This book covers some good basics for someone who wishes to build or especially rebuild a Ford Modular engine. The book begins with a short history of the modern Ford engine, the tools needed to perform the project starting and some suggested suppliers for parts and tools. The author rightly starts with disassembly. And takes you step by step through the process of rebuilding with some advice that can enhance performance or save you funds.The main examples of this book, and its focus, is on the 1996 4.6L SOHC Romeo engine from a Mustang GT. Each step in the process is explained and combined with many photographs that are pertinent to the subject being discussed. This is a book you would want out on your workbench along with Fords manual. If you are considering a Ford 4.6L modular rebuild I would definitely read this book first so you can understand the scope and complexity of the project and make an informed decision. The picture, charts and illustrations are clear and useful as is the well written text. An excellent addition to your automotive library. I took a 1/2 star off because the title does reflect the overall subject matter but is focused on only one specific engine build and in general only SOHC engines.

I have dry skin so I am always willing to try new moisturizers. The lotion is the consistency of a normal lotion, is fragrance free and my skin absorbed it quickly with no greasy feeling. It does a splendid job of moisturizing dry skin and I would defiantly get this product again. It is nice when a product can live up to is product description.

I played the original X-COM series and X-COM: Enemy Unknown. This expansion adds new elements to the game, some extra missions and more configurable/enhanced soldiers. I can't seem to stop playing; it is addictive. I feel I should warn anyone who plans on getting this that in order to use the expansion you must start a new game. Which for me was fine as I love the game. And for less then $10 this expansion can not be beat. It was an instant buy for me.

I was looking forward to the arrival of the Belkin AC1200 router as I had a I have a Linksys WRT54G that I have used for over a decade; and it still works. The AC1200 was a fast and easy setup right out of the box. It comes with simple to follow instructions and was up and running literally in minutes. The antennas are inside of the vertical standing covering so you can not position them, Though this has not affected my performance and the case seems more fragile then the router it is replacing.With the Belkin AC1200 I have an improvement in signal strength throughout my domicile and less lag. I am running multiple computers on this network. This router has features that the home user will even want to use. From parental controls, to overall system filtering and the one I liked, a guest access option. The Guest Access option allows you to have a  second yet slower Wi-Fi network with its own password that you can give to other to use to access the internet. Thus leaving your network more secure.Please remember that I am not a computer guy and my last router is over a decade old. So I do not know how this would stand up compared to the  more expensive ac routers that are out there. But then again they are at a much higher price then this unit and would be out of my price range. For my home network I find this to be an improvement. Now lets see if it can last as long as my Linsys has.

When I received this pack and read the list of ingredients I was very happy to see cheese listed first. Of the four flavors of seasonings I tried this is my favorite. It is fantastic on popcorn. I liked it so much I tried it on a baked potato and was pleased with it taste. It comes in an easy to use shaker container that allows a liberal amount to be dispense but still taste flavored to my taste. I would get this product again.

When I received this pack it reminded me of the seasonings now used at other Cineplex. I was surprised they taste as good as those and contain no MSG. I enjoyed all the flavors with the spicy buffalo wings being my favorite. The Jalapeo is not really spice and is over whelmed by the cheese and the Bacon Cheddar lives up to its name in taste. Over all a good enhancement to popcorn and easy to apply. Note I would have rated these higher if the flavors that should have been spicy were.

A bag of caramel  chocolate truffle ball. I cant explain it but the caramel permeates this as the primary flavor but you still get the hint of chocolate. The flavors meld together as this ball of deliciousness melts in your mouth. I normally think caramel is ok and love chocolate but these where very good and I would gladly consume more. It is not my top choice of  their offered products but it was as I put in the title; tasty.

This is Lipton Teas' version of a  water sweetening concentrate. The directions state you should use one squirt for 8 ounces which will make an overly sweet drink (I needed more water than that). But with the additional water it does make for a good tasting flavored tea. The first ingredient is honey which is good but they didnt stop there. The last ingredient is an artificial sweetener which this may not have needed. I would drink this again as once mixed to your taste it is good.

Irish Spring Gear Body Wash Gear lathers up with rich suds, and rinses off cleanly without leaving you with a oily feeling. It is like a bar of Irish Spring in gel/lotion form with a slightly different scent. The version I have says it is skin hydrating and has Vitamin E in it. My towns water is hard and most soaps along with that leave my skin in need of a moisturizer. After using this a while I notice my skin is still dry but not as bad as it was. Finally a body wash I would recommend someone try. Only reason its not 5 stars is its current  price.

This is a green salsa that has a good taste and very, very, small bite. I thought I was eating a mild salsa. If this is their medium I hope they have a Very Hot version, that I would love to try. I used this as a dip for chips and it did add a good flavor just no heat. I used more salsa per chip than I should have because I was trying to get some spice. Amazon also did a great job in shipping these, very fast and secure in a double box. If most salsas are too hot for you then this  is the one you should try. I would not buy the medium again but I sure would eat it.

This shaving cream does work out of the tube using your fingers to lather it on like a lotion but this also causes you to use more than is required. Like the old days a small dab and a brush to froth it up gives you a light coat to apply. I can not imagine many people having shaving brushes today. Either form of application allows you to shave and leaves you with a clean shave and a slight scent. The scent must come from the listed ingredients of chamomile and witch hazel.Edit: Feb 2015. This product last me one year. I will be purchasing this product again.

This shower gel when applied with wash cloth will clean you. But too get a lather takes a liberal amount of product. I have used another Axe shower Gel before and except for the different scent it seems the same. In this particular gel I do not like the scent and wish it had none. I actually removed 1 star because of the scent. I would rather use a bar of soap than this product.

Considered buying this vs the Park Tool PCS-9 and PCS-10. Here are my thoughts.Feedback Sports Pro Ultralight:- 170$ approx, 10.6 lbs, made in taiwan- quick release tabs on extension tubes and folds up easily- feels solid and sturdy, tubes are thicker and bigger than the picture suggest- solid clamp mechanism, i believe still plastic connector, but feels very solidPark Tool PCS-9:- 140$ approx, 23 lbs, made in china- no quick release on extension tubes- heavier, harder to use, harder to setup and take downPark Tool PCS-10:- 180$ approx, 25 lbs, made in china- quick release on extension tubes- heavier- large plastic clamp armIn summary, for the price, it is lighter and better than the similarly priced park tool PCS-10. I'm sure if you spend even more money you can get a high quality stand, but this works for my occasional hobbyist type jobs. I would still recommend the Park Tool HBH-2 Handle Bar Holder. This is key to work with the front wheel easily.I will update as I use this over time. I imagine it will hold up for many years though.

Order 1 size larger than typical for your kid. My daughter is 7 years old and wears 6-7 sizes pretty easily as she is below 50% on the growth curve and skinny. i had to get her the 8 as the 7 was too tight.otherwise it is a great and durable swimsuit and she loves it for swimming. still going strong after 6 months.one note, a reviewer mentioned that it stretched really fast. i haven't noticed the same but I strongly recommend either air drying or using a low heat setting to dry (mixed with other towels). I've heard from a friend that spandex (i.e. Lycra.. which is what all swimsuits are made from) loses stretch faster at high heat drying.

excellent balance bike for an upgrade to the Strider. my son outgrew the strider at 5 years old and this was the perfect transition while I wait for him to be ready for gear shift bikes. I prefer gear shift over coaster brake bikes (found on early trainer bikes) as you can coast without pedaling similar to the balance bike concept, thus the transition is easier from balance to gear shift.- real rubber tires that you must pump up provide better cushion- seat adjustable with quick release- one-hand brake on right (though you can move to left if you want)- no kickstand (these are cheap at walmart)- lightweight- smooth glidinghighly recommend. pricey but good quality.

excellent size. my kid can hold it easily. I bought to help my kid understand time, but find i want to borrow it for the kitchen.- turns easily- reliable (at least to my estimation)- softer ring isn't annoying. is a bit short. but i like it this way.- magnetic feature is awesomehighly recommend.

this came out around the same time as tinkerbell neverbeast. Both movies try to tug on your heartstrings and show the main character struggle with such life challenges. However unlike neverbeast this movie was sincere and warm. the scary moments were well played out and rationale such that though my kids were scared, they didn't have nightmares all night (which unfortunately neverbeast did do).There are truly funny moments that we still laugh about when we think back on this movie.The scenes near the ending brought tears to my eyes and show a strong and good human spirit. It inspires you to want to do good and to cherish those close to you. It gave me lots of opportunities to talk to my kids about adult-type issues and situations.I love this movie. My kids love this movie. Please make more of these, Disney.
Riedell appears to be a reputable brand.these are snug, warm, comfortable. blades come ready to use.would recommend.

sturdy and protective. i got a pair of ice skates recently for my daughter and these have ample room to grow and look to easily hold adult sized skates too. the clear flexible ring thing allows you to adjust to the size of the skate.worthwhile buy to keep skates from ripping thru bags or clothes unexpectedly.

First I very highly recommend these bottles. I used to use the thermos funtainer bottles for my kids at school, but i've switched over to these instead because they are so much easier to clean. Plus the funtainer bottles' silicon tip straws would degrade over time from chewing and dishwashing.STRENGTHS:- cap easy to take apart in 3 pieces for easy washing- a click lock on the lid to prevent accidental spills (love this!)- lid can lock in open position so it doesn't hit you in face- made in thailand (ok just useful for some to know...)- dishwasher safe (i use the top shelf to be safe)- very slender and tall design (about 9in x 2.5in with cap on)- colors are awesome and shiny- brother thermal labels stick well to it- keeps things both hot and cold decently (my coffee at work is still hot after an 8 hour shift, and my kids milk is still very cold after 7 hrs at school with 3 ice cubes inside to start)WEAKNESSES:- narrow opening so makes pouring into it tricky sometimes- I read a review saying the cap can crack if you drop it...- pricey (30$ on average)- color selection isn't broadVS FUNTAINER THERMOS:- funtainer has a straw with a silicone tip. the tip degrades over time and dishwashing and after it cracks too much the top no longer seals and spills occur even with the top closed.- funtainer also uses a glue to attach the plastic base, this glue will leak and ooze over time in the hot dishwasher. zojirushi uses a stainless steel base.- no lock, i've had spills in my kids' bag and this is totally not cool- a pain to clean the straw part. i even have a camelbak straw cleaner but it's a pain to clean every day.- doesn't seem to keep hot/cold sealed as long as zojirushi- some funtainers have a flip-up carrying loop. this is sort of nice but not essential for meSM-KHE48 vs SM-SA48:I noticed 2 different version and I purchased both because i wanted certain colors. Both hold 16-oz and are tall and slender with a shiny color design. both have similar prices.The cap is slightly larger for the KHE48 and has a rubber ring where the cap meets the inner piece and the rubber seal where it meets the thermos. The SA48 only has a rubber seal where it meets the thermos. both seem to seal excellently without leaking. both have 3-piece caps (middle sipping section, cap, and rubber top stopper).the inside of KHE48 is stainless steel. the SA48 seems to have a nonstick coating or something on the inside covering the stainless steel. no bad chemical smells though. both seem to work well and don't affect the taste of the contents. depends on how picky you are about these things.KHE48 has english writing. SA48 has japanese writing.--------------------------OVERALL:awesome! though pricey, they have lasting power like most japanese products. their attention to detail is excellent. I get tons of compliments about this thermos.

I have loved the other tinkerbell movies, cherishing the fact that most (until the pirate fairy one) didn't have a true bad/evil guy. Just some relationship/friendship conflicts that ultimately got sorted out in the end. the life challenges were real and the positive messages clear and meaningful.This movie starts with a warm and gentle beast. Then the director attempts to truly scare the target audience of young kids with irrationally frightful scenes with truly angry and scary beast expressions that don't have much explanation. in one case of tinkerbell getting hurt, it is simply a bad camera angle for the audience. The beast grows devil like horns and wings, again it seems in just a wild irrational gesture to scare the audience even more. Finally the beast redeems himself with some kind actions. the ending has sad moments of death and loss.My young kids (7 and under) were devastated by this and had nightmares the same night. I was hopelessly lost in finding rational explanations as to why the beast looked angry and did seemingly hurtful things. i looked to tinkerbell always to prompt useful discussion about life lessons. this time i was just hugging my kids while they huddled in fear.John Lasseter, I respected you for what you did for Miyazaki's treasures. You truly failed your most precious audience this time.
a rediculous amt. we use to store pokemon cards. fit perfectly. need a 3 ring binder to hold. only a rare few are broken.would buy again.

spigen is a solid company. their cases are slim and protective. their covers work well.i've used their screen protectors for years. they last 1+ years especially if you have a case to prevent the edges from folding up and these include 3 so likely more than 2yrs (at which point you will likely upgrade your phone).very clear and easy to apply. line up carefully. touch screen digitizer is unchanged.if you have frayed edges or line up holes wrong, just use a razor blade to cut it. Remember glass is harder than steel thus a razor blade will never scratch or cut glass.

spigen is a solid company. their cases are slim and protective. their covers work well.i've used their screen protectors for years. they last 1+ years especially if you have a case to prevent the edges from folding up and these include 3 so likely more than 2yrs (at which point you will likely upgrade your phone).very clear and easy to apply. line up carefully. touch screen digitizer is unchanged.if you have frayed edges or line up holes wrong, just use a razor blade to cut it. Remember glass is harder than steel thus a razor blade will never scratch or cut glass.

decent silicone sleeve if you want a tiny bit of extra protection and don't want to add any weight. it is dirty cheap.I recommend though the "Samsonite Silicone Bumper Case". Those are thicker, more protective, and are very durable. Thus better for kids. Plus those can be carried one-handed by grasping an edge.
these things are so darn easy to lose. works well. download the logitech software to reprogram any mouse/keyboard/etc. it is universal so multiple devices can be linked to one receiver.

perfect for adding a doorstop to any spring door.I use a drill to make pilot holes then screw in manually.looks nice and seems durable. if you fear it won't stay in the flipped up position I can say that my other one has lasted 3 yrs and still going strong.highly recommend
works in my honda pilot. please check your model number before buying. looks like OEM and fits perfectly.I change yearly.
excellent trauma shears. they will dull eventually but last longer.I'm using subscribe and save to meet the 5 item 20% off.perfect for use around house to cut hard to cut objects.highly recommend

these sight word books are excellent for teaching a young one to read. better than the random themed sight word books. each book is an interesting daily life topic with simple pictures (left side) and big words (right side). they are short enough to be enjoyable. fun enough to read over and over again.I give my kid a star sticker to put on the book each time they read it without help and we're advancing nicely.3 levels in total and by that time I expect they can read cooler books like Mo Willems.

these sight word books are excellent for teaching a young one to read. better than the random themed sight word books. each book is an interesting daily life topic with simple pictures (left side) and big words (right side). they are short enough to be enjoyable. fun enough to read over and over again.I give my kid a star sticker to put on the book each time they read it without help and we're advancing nicely.3 levels in total and by that time I expect they can read cooler books like Mo Willems.

This is too small to balance properly. bought for my kid. make sure you adjust the string length. i would favor the 5" models instead. I'm not convinced amazon sells any model that is that great to be honest. this one looks like it was shipped from china.

I'm willing to keep it for now but I have my doubts. It probably is better than no case...- this adds a decent amt of weight to the ipad- 2 layer, inside layer is plastic snap-together case, outer is slippery rubber-like- all ports easily accessible (button and volume control are thru the rubber coating but work well)- kick stand is nearly impossible to pull off, thus this feature becomes useless- front plastic covers just to the visible screen edge- does come with stylus pen which doesn't work that great- color does look cool- very good price compared to otterboxOverall, I want to like the case, but 2 things make me concerned. it adds a decent amt of weight which would potentially make the ipad more prone to dropping... also you would think the cushion layer would be on the inside and hard casing on the outside. Most 2-layer cell phone cases are such. The screen is the crack risk when dropped and having hard plastic directly against it wouldn't seem to make much sense. Admittedly otterbox makes a defender case that also has a hard first layer against the screen.Only time will tell. My son breaks enough things that I will definitely be "testing" this one out many times.UPDATE 7/2014:---------------I bought 2 of these for 2 ipads both screens cracked after <6mo of use. this is unlikely a coincidence. both cracked on the edges where this plastic inner layer covers. I believe as above that the hard plastic inner layer is DEFINITELY not a good idea. I recommend avoiding all cases of this type. should be TPU/silicon/rubber inner layer first.

if you like Go this is a solid set to get.- decent size to make play easy yet not so large that it isn't portable- smooth stone like plastic pieces with a gentle magnet on the bottom to keep it attached to board- plastic bowls to store stones in. bowls can be stored in the fold-over compartment inside- board is as expected and a standard go styleIf your kids like Go consider as well watching Hikaru no Go. It is an anime about a young boy who enters the world of Go by accident. Also a fun insiders view into the world of Go in Japanese culture. They take it very seriously there it seems.Lastly a safety point... these are swallow hazards and choking hazards. i worry more about swallowing though as if you swallow 2+ they can magnetically stick to each other in your bowels and cause the tissue to erode and die off. A rare but serious cause of a surgical emergency.

each pack is two sides folded in half and each side contains gum. this is decently tasty and as always trident focuses on healthy teeth. won't whiten them or anything but has xylitol which has some studies that show benefit in reducing cavities.It does have aspartame if that is important to you.

This yo yo actually would be pretty awesome... if not for a purposely built in design that will shred the string.GOOD:- spins fast and easily- string is regular yo yo quality, solid- good weight- slight butterfly style design to make it more forgiving then the bell shaped ones- it can be twisted open to change the string which is awesome for a yo yo- the center spindle looks like a ball bearing type mechanism which probably explains the sound below and who it can spin so well and smoothlyBAD:- makes a noticeable metallic churning sound as it spins, i don't mind but i see other reviewers don't like it. it isn't high pitched, just noticeable. again like i said not a bad thing for me...- each half has spike like plastic triangles protruding into the middle just a few mm away from the spindle. as it spins i'm certain these spikes are rubbing against the string on each side. thus the string lifespan goes way down. why the heck would anyone design it like this? i can understand smooth bumps if it were to help keep the yo yo centered as it spins, but these are sharp and spiky. it makes no sense at all except as a built in feature to purposely reduce string life. For now i've put scotch tape over each spike to blunt them a bit. i might switch to white electrical tape if this doesn't work.OVERALL:Again if they would simply change the spikes (remove them or make them smooth bumps) this yo yo would be awesome as long as you don't mind the noise. So an awesome yo yo made awful by one design flaw. Please consider a re-design if the manufacturer is reading this.

Nothing flashy, nothing high tech. Just amazing story telling and drama played out by excellent actors. the twist at the end is hard to predict on your own and it forces you to watch it again for the clues.worth a watch every few years just to remind yourself how awesome this movie remains.

one of the cheapest flash drives you can get these days. very durable and no loose parts to lose.I use a few as windows utility drives now. one for win7 installation disc, macrium recovery disc, and the venerable Hiren's BootCD toolkit.if you want one on the keychain I strongly recommend Kingston Digital DataTraveler SE9 16GB USB 2.0 (DTSE9H/16GBZET). it stays on the keychain, takes a beating and works solid.

I couldn't believe it, after I installed this thing, my printer started to have a mind of its own. I found it the other day trying to sabotage the color printer by pulling out its power cord... it also will sometimes instead of printing my expected print job, print a list of demands for better pay and benefits...seriously dudes... it's a high capacity toner cartridge. this is from Brother so it will work without a hitch. remember to shake it a few times when it says "low toner" to make it last longer. Some also argue to cover the sensor hole with piece of scotch tape blackened with permanent marker to trick the printer out of the "low toner" alert.Brother makes solid printers.

tongs have many uses in a busy kitchen. my old one broke at the hinge as the bolt keeping it together fell apart. i don't see much improvement in the design unfortunately but as long as it works, it does work well.- 9 inch version is a solid size to give you good control. longer only necessary if you are bbq on a big grill.- spring loaded is key for ease of use.- the black circle thing in the back allows you to keep it closed when not in use. again an essential feature. light weight.NOTE: this is exactly the same as the slightly pricier Oxo version (except the black circle has Oxo stamped on it) so don't bother with that.

this is one of the few times staple goods are cheaper on amazon compared to big box retail (ie, walmart, target, costco). This comes to 3$ approx per package while my grocery carries it for 3.70$ approx. very cool.same size. same taste. gluten free. these have higher fiber content than their other flavors and taste better in my opinion as well. try it with guac dip and you will be addicted like me.

The MB706 is shockingly bright for a device sporting 1 LED although not as bright as the MB723. Running off 4 AAA batteries the unit itself is a decent size, not too bulky but also with that being said, not incredibly attractive. The light itself is bright enough to provide safe passage down basement stairs, into a dark attic or crawl space and with some thought on placement of several units you do get enough illumination where overhead light isn't actually needed.Living in the Northeast with the new onslaught of hurricane weather we're trying to make sure we're more prepared. The MB706 was purchased along with several MB723 to give us the ability to traverse our home safely in the even the power was out. Utilizing battery driven devices ensures that we are always ready and prepared.Thus far the MB706 has met our expectations and we've managed to light a few closets in the house only using 2 of the lights and placing them on opposing sides of the door frame. In other areas we've placed 1 of them on near our master bathroom toilet so our 5 year old can use the bathroom at night without fumbling for switches. In our pantry they allow for better view while searching for that can of soup you knew you had 2 days ago.The motion sensing feature works nicely and has a decent range allowing you to stagger placement where one light will provide enough coverage to allow you to set off another light along the way.Overall a very nice addition to any home where you need extra light or want to use them as safety lights. I do wish though there was a nicer set possibly with different finishes such as brushed stainless steel or other colors to suit the varied rooms as the stark white limits one in regards to aesthetics.

When it comes to my screen protectors I always prefer tempered glass. Using a touchscreen with a plastic film to protect the screen removes that smooth, sold feel one gets when scrolling and tapping and creates unnecessary and unpleasant drag. Tempered glass, once applied, is the next best thing to a completely naked screen - but, how many of us want to take such a risk? Not many I would say.In reality, the investment of any electronic warrants the purchase of a tempered glass protector on your screen. Should you suffer that unfortunate collision with your keys or maybe that horrific mating of pavement and your lovely device falling face first, tempered glass screen protectors really do aid in protecting from scratched and some of those less harsh blunt force shocks to mid-screen.The Pandaren works really well on my Vita and the fit is quite precise only allowing for a small margin of error when applying. The best way I've found to apply is to use 2 pieces of tape to hold the protector on the Vita once you've managed to find that sweet alignment. Use the tape to create a temporary hinge allowing you to swing it away, clean that screen one more time, remove the film and swing into place. Press the tempered glass in the middle and watch it adhere like magic. Your Vita is now happy and less prone to the malicious nature of life.I must add that, to date, I've gone through two of the screen protectors. One met an unfortunate end when my Vita was in my messenger bag and grazed against my archery release which scratched it pretty deep. The second kept my screen safe when a desk lamp tipped over hitting my screen. In both cases the tempered glass was sacrificed leaving my screen in perfect, flawless condition!

The Trophy Take Spring Steel 2 Pro was my first choice when setting up a new target bow. The consistency of a fixed blade, lizard tongue style rest is known among the archery community and when one takes a moment to evaluate the setup of serious archers to the pros you can see that a fixed blade is the go-to arrow rest.The Trophy Taker Spring Steel 2 Pro incorporates mirco-adjustment capabilities via a set of micro-adjust knobs that are held by set screws. Simply loosen the set screw and you can easily and confidently make the necessary adjustments without having to fully remove any screws or worry that your adjustments will be so tedious that you settle on anything but spot-on.The range of micro-adjustment is a bit awkward at times when one is moving between the set ranges; the availability of micro-adjustment is limited to the movement of the set screw within a small area. Once you've reached the maximum range for the set screws current hole you must remove it entirely and set it into the next range hole. This process isn't entirely difficult or tedious but you do have to then back down the micro-adjustment to cover the lower end of the range you were trying to achieve.Overall, a great buy. I've found that my grouping is beautiful and the ability to truly fine tune with the use of some measurement tools such as a goniometer for the blade angle and a micrometer for the center-shot really work well together.The consistency of the arrow flight can be seen immediately once the rest has been tuned and I even found it rather forgiving when realizing that my center shot had been skewed when traveling with my bow and sending off a few arrows with only minor issues in impact point.

The MB723 is shockingly bright for a device sporting 1 LED. Running off 4 AA batteries the unit itself is a decent size, not too bulky but also with that being said, not incredibly attractive. The light itself is bright enough to provide safe passage down basement stairs, into a dark attic or crawl space and with some thought on placement of several units you do get enough illumination where overhead light isn't actually needed.Living in the Northeast with the new onslaught of hurricane weather we're trying to make sure we're more prepared. The MB723 was purchased (20 in total) to give us the ability to traverse our home safely in the even the power was out. Utilizing battery driven devices ensures that we are always ready and prepared.Thus far the MB723 has met our expectations and we've managed to light an entire basement (75x50ft) only using 8 of the lights and placing them on opposing walls about 5 feet from the floor. In other areas we've placed 2 of them on a full flight of stairs with another on the wall at the top of the stairs to allow for full coverage of the floor to avoid falls in the dark. Our attic and crawl space have been lit by the MB723 as well only using a few of the lights with some thought on placement.The motion sensing feature works nicely and has a decent range allowing you to stagger placement where one light will provide enough coverage to allow you to set off another light along the way.Overall a very nice addition to any home where you need extra light or want to use them as safety lights. I do wish though there was a nicer set possibly with different finishes such as brushed stainless steel or other colors to suit the varied rooms as the stark white limits one in regards to aesthetics.
This is my first pair of New Balance and I have to say that I really like them. I have somewhat narrow feet and they fit incredibly well. I'm pleased with the fit and comfort.

Simply amazing.I've returned to archery after many years and I traversed from wrist strap releases to thumb and finally hinge style back tension. I couldn't be happier with my choice to change. I honestly never thought I was "punching" my thumb release which I enjoyed and found gave me a more consistent and sold anchor. The very first shot with the Backspin showed me just how much unnecessary back pull and shoulder flexion and abduction I was applying with my follow through after release. It was a significant amount; enough to make me realize I needed a hinge style release instead to make me focus on form, timing and really applying a gentle pressure through the valley to the wall against my anchor point instead of trying to pull with all my might.The release does take some time to get used to and you need to focus on your hand positioning as to not suffer a misfire while drawing your bow back. The mechanism is simple and easy to understand once you actually see the release. A small adjustment to the moon makes for a good amount of change to the release sensitivity in my experience and I would suggest making incremental adjustments over the course of adapting to the release rather that simply setting it "hot" and thinking it will be safe.After shooting about 100 arrows with the release I will say that I won't go back to wrist or thumb style releases at this point and will be selling them off to purchase a back up Backspin as I always like to have two. I may try the 4 finger or other variations.I will also add that the bearing finger hole really does reduce drag and makes for a smooth action when rotating to set off the hinge and hook. A great design!

I purchased this release after finding that my grouping wasn't what it could be. After some research I opted for a thumb release and I really wanted something that reduced  torque against the d-loop. The Boss X 4 finger is comfortable to use, the option to customize the trigger travel and sensitivity really makes a big difference in use and consistency.On the very first use I really did notice a big difference in my grouping which has improved each day. My anchor point is more consistent and my form has improved which you will hear from many people once they transition from a wrist based release to a hand release such as the Boss X.I've used both the 3 and 4 finger version of the Boss X and I have yet to choose a favorite really but I think it comes down to personal preference as does a great many things in archery. I will say though the benefit of the 4 finger is that it can be used with 3-4 fingers so the versatility is a plus.

A quality quiver that sits just right and I've fit up to 16 arrows in it. The extra pockets come in handy and it has one large zippered pouch, a smaller zippered pouch, a pocket that is really nice to just drop a hand release in and up near the belt loop section there is a place to store pens and small objects. Not shown in the picture is a belt loop hook that can attach to your pants or pocket without having to use a belt. This addition works well but is not as stable as attaching to a belt.Overall the build quality to date is sturdy with a solid feel. Using the hook attached to a belt loop the quiver hangs a little lower and does sway but with a single, narrow point of attachment this is to be expected. The large zippered pocket and the large pouch in the front both fit my 4 finger release well without having to squeeze it in or struggle to remove it. My arrows sit well in the tubes which have a triangular rather than circular opening which stops them from rolling around and eventually falling out; this shows some forethought in design over my daughters Bohning hip quiver which arrows eventually roll out from all the movement. You won't have this as much with this quiver because honestly the arrows barely move and as you remove them they shift towards the apex of the tube which locks them in place a bit.As of right now, I'm quite pleased with this field quiver. I've never liked the feel of a hip quiver because I feel like the arrows are a distraction and in my way when I walk. A field quiver solves this by placing the arrows behind you and it just feels more natural for me. I expect this quiver to last a while due to the build quality. Should things change, I'll update.

Just put these on my Hoyt Vector Turbo and was shocked at the amount of dampening they provide. On the very first shot there was a noticeable difference. I also love the fact that they install so easily. And for anyone asking, the Vector Turbo has a 3/4 inch gap between the limbs and these fit neatly in place with no movement noted. I would definitely buy these again for another bow.

This bow was a disappointment really. After opening it I was initially pleased; the bow is well designed and balanced with a great feel and finish. The draw is smooth as you'd expect from a single cam system with a solid back wall.Unfortunately, like the other customer stated, my bow too began to wear with only 9 shots. The wear on mine was not limited to just the serving but actually damaged my string just at the part where the serving ends. I didn't feel confident that this bow wasn't going to cost me more in string replacements and subsequent tuning within a short time. Sad really. This bow would warrant 5 stars if not for this poor design. Out of the box though this shouldn't happen. I returned it and treated myself to a PSE Bow Madness instead.
Crap, no matches, not sure what I'd use it for besides burning
What more is there to say? The case fits, the buttons line up perfectly and are easy to press. The case protects and looks great!

I loved the look of this case since its slim and comfortable to hold. The rubber grips on the side make for great handling, however, the white/gray rubber yellowed in a matter of 2 days after I received it which is find to be completely unacceptable.
Honestly, not satisfied with this case. The case is sturdy but the button alignment is completely off which makes the case difficult to use.

The Bowery has become the permanent home for my gear. The small size is actually quite versatile and holds my XT-1, X100, 18-55mm, hood, 6 batteries and flash along with my phone and spare battery.When I feel like carrying a larger bag I just remove the shoulder strap from my Bowery and place it in my messenger bag. No need to remove my gear or move things around since, as an insert, it exceeds expectations.

I adore this camera!Overall this camera produces incredible images as long as you have the know how and experience. If you are a photographer who learned on film and manual you will feel at home with this beautifully designed, retro styling. The dials are convenient and accessible and the handling is amazing and intuitive.I had previously sold my XPro1 and X100s, somewhat bittersweet with my decision. I love the X-Trans sensors, the retro design and handling but...I couldn't live with the AF speed which, quite frankly, utterly annoyed me to no end. Not only do I use my gear for pro work but I do keep them handy for those candid moments where I want to capture my 4 year old doing something goofy. Don't get me wrong, when I did capture an image the quality was second to none. But, the focus used to hunt so much and lock on 50% of the time that I had to part with my Fuji's.I promised myself that "If they fix the AF issue, I'll sell my other gear and be a Fuji lover once again." Not only have they fixed the AF issues but added WiFi which I love for fast uploads and use of a smartphone as a remote shutter.A weekend with the X-T1 and I was sold. Fuji, unlike any other manufacturer, listened to their customer base. They dealt with and improved the AF issues and included more useful features.My only gripe...the ISO dial is a burdensome, round, hellish thing. But one can live with this and learn to deal with the minor quirk. I wish they lock on the ISO dial had the ability to be unlocked for more freedom but it really is a small issue.The XT-1 has me happy and I am drooling over the X100T which I preordered in the hopes that they AF is as fast, if not faster, than my XT-1.You can't go wrong with this camera. Fuji continues to update and my suggestion..pick up the black XT-1 now and upgrade the firmware in December when they electronic shutter and Classic Chrome features of the new Graphite edition are available.

I picked this up at a local store since it seemed like a good option over a pistol grip for my camera. As a mini tripod that costs $25 I'm not all that sure what people expect it to do. It holds a camera steady as a tripod and offers a stable hold as a grip. Its a no frills, easy to use tripod. Costing $25 you should realize that it is made out of plastic and isn't a carbon fiber mini tripod with an included hydrostatic ball head with a clutch design...lets be real people.Some state the ballhead isn't smooth and is "sticky." If you look at the design the metal is textured to assist with increased grip and decreased creeping with your camera attached. One look at it and anyone would see this was done for a reason.The button is not simple to push but upon taking it apart the mechanism is designed this way to allow for the maximum hold in consideration of the materials and obviously the price point.This holds my OMD EM5, GX7 with a Panasonic 35-100 without issue. My 7D with a nifty fifty shows minimal creep but it does hold well.Overall this mini tripod does what it claims to do and for the price its actually a good deal!

I purchased this for an upcoming trip and prior to leaving I opted to put the battery pack through some testing to ensure I wouldn't be stuck without power for my tablets and phones.Charging takes some time but considering the capacity of the unit I'm not surprised. Initially it comes partially charged and I was able to charge my Galaxy Note 3 about 2.5 times before I needed to charge the battery itself. One of the advantages of this battery over my Energizer brand ones is that this unit charges with the same cables you use for most of the devices; namely a micro USB male cable. Charging took about 8 hours and the indicator light shows 4 blue LEDs to reflect a full charge.On a single charge I was able to charge my Note 3 twice and my three Note 8 tablets each once with some residual charge still available to top my phone off later on in the day.The added LED flashlight is a nice touch and although gimicky I did actually use it once when searching through my messenger bag for my keys when I returned late at night from my trip.

My Note 8 was the tablet that I found to be the most used and yet the only issue I had was that I prefer to keep it in a simple sleeve in my messenger bag. Doing so had me worried about my screen breaking despite using a screen protector film.I have used tempered glass on my other devices and I've always found that on Samsung devices they interfere with the proximity sensor which causes problems with the use of many of the tablets feature such as Smart Stay. Many tempered glass products, being fully transparent glass, tend to simplify the manufacturing process by making a sheet of glass that has no cutouts and only conforms to the overall shape of the tablet. The TechPro is a bit different in that it has a cutout that allows the front sensor to be unobscured allowing your sensor to work at full capacity.Installation is quite easy and from experience I have learned that not only should you clean your screen but you should also use low-tack blue painter's tape or masking tape to remove any residual dust from the screen that you may not notice. By using the tape you can ensure that the screen protector will go on flawlessly without any imperfections beneath.

One of the things I notice as my use of tablets increases is that I prefer to keep them in a sleeve and not in a bulky case that takes away from the design and tactile feel of holding the device. Since my tablets aren't used to the extent of my phone I don't mind keeping them bare whereas my phone is contained in whatever affords me the most protection.I purchased this case, obviously, for my Note 8 which is carried with me in my messenger bag, neatly tucked away and safe. I chose the simple sleeve because I wanted to protect the device from scratching that may occur against my camera or lenses I always carry. The sleeve does what it should but I must note that it does not have a solid insert on the screen side and is indeed a simple, soft, flexible sleeve. It is because of this that I purchased a tempered glass screen protector for my Note 8 to bolster the screen protection.If you want a simple case that lets your tablet roam naked and don't need the protection of an Otterbox or such then this is a decent case for the price.

I purchased this for my wife as a gift since she is a huge fan of the Instax series by Fuji and I myself have always loved Fuji's color representation in film.The printer is small, light and pretty portable making it something I would consider bringing to a party or event where it would be fun to share the pictures with others. Setup is straight forward; you insert the film which can only be done one way, insert the batteries and turn it on. On your smartphone you install the app and it walks you through the process of connecting to the printer.On my first try I was able to complete the process in about 6 minutes from batteries, film to printing with my Note 3, my note 8 tablet and my Nexus 7 tablet. Unfortunately on my wife's phone we had some issues that took a while to figure out and she has the same phone (Note 3). After some investigation she discovered that her settings for WiFi connectivity were not the same as mine so we made some changes and the printer worked well afterwards.Overall the printer is gimicky but you don't buy such a device for prints to hang on the wall. The Instax series by Fuji brings the fun of Polaroid to the film and color quality you find with Fuji and the Instax Share printer allows you to basically turn any picture on your smartphone or tablet into an instant print which is fun.And just a suggestion to anyone interested in it,...purchase extra batteries.
