There was plenty of action, as in epic battles, to keep me entertained not to mention the swoon-worth heat between them. The secondaries were great bonus, which makes me want to really read their stories now. Erin is so sassy I cant wait to sink my teeth into her book! The HEA was all I could hope for and seeing how it ended, if Ms. Heaton was to write a what-happens-next book, I certainly would not say no to the read.As I mentioned before, I jumped into the series without any previous history. I dont recommend doing that. There really is a feel of world building with the characters and the situations that I feel I have missed out on. Knowing how off the hook Ms. Heatons stories, I think its fairly safe to say this series was awesome. I do recommend reading Her Sinful Angel but only after reading the Her Angel series from the beginning.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3.5, Flames - 3

Well color me surprised! Hotter With A Pole was not what I expected. There's not a whole lot of time to get a developed story, so normally novellas are very 'Hi-wham-bam-HEA-the-end'. You don't expect to get a story that's moving but that is exactly what I got here.Let's start with the title; Not a fan of it. It implied I was going to get a tacky smutfest. I mean come on, hot fireman plus hot biker equal a smutfest right?! What I got was a story that actually had depth with interesting characters. Noah and Hoyt were a complete treat. Okay, yes they did hop in the sack fairly quickly, but they also had emotional personal baggage that they need to work through. Both had experienced loss of someone close and both were afraid of take a chance of getting hurt again. Added bonus were all Noah's firemen friends.Instead of acting like fillers, they actually contribute to the story. Enough so that I look forward to reading their stories. My favorite secondary character: Hoyt's mom. *SNICKERS!!!*Hotter with a Pole is my first book by author Delilah Devlin. If this is any indication of what I can expect from her, it won't be the last. This book was well worth the read!I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 4, Flames - 4

Just finished Bo and oh my! I have a new favorite Carolina boy. Not boy, MAN! Unlike all the other characters in Ms. Warren's Bad Boys of Retribution MC series, I think Bo is the one that is in need of the biggest hug. Don't get me wrong. Bo is just as hot and sexy as all her other characters. He just seems to be the most broken inside. His last Recon mission left him with PTSD, survivor's guilt and he isn't coping very well. Paging Doctor Veronica Hartley! Smart, sexy and the star of his dreams, Bo doesn't want her help. Luckily for him she's just a stubborn and finds a way to get him help and let his secrets out. He, however, isn't the only one with secrets and now it's his turn to do some rescuing.So unlike the previous two books in the series, I personally think Bo was more on the dangerous side. I'm not going into details because it would spoil the surprise although I will say I did cringe a bit. What I can say is the dangerous side (Think SOA) is welcome because we get to see more of the Retribution guys. WooHoo! I love all the secondary characters in this series. Tuck, Tail, Handsome, and the rest of the bad boys are all making an appearance. What makes a ding-ding bonus for me as getting to find out how well the past Retribution main characters are doing.I've read pretty much every book Rie Warren has written. They all tend to be first person POV from the guy's perspective and I got to say, she's really nailed how I guy thinks, talks and acts. I think that's what makes her books so special. I personally think everybody should be reading her book. But don't just take my word for it. Grab yourself a copy of all the books in the Bad Boys of Retribution MC series and judge for yourself and be prepared to be blow away.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 4.5 Flames - 4

Every time I look at the cover of Coyote's Kiss I keep thinking I'm going to be reading a gay PNR. Don't ask me why the cover screams male PNR it just does. BUT, it's not. It's action - YES! Shifters - YES! and loads of fun.Luca has quite the wicked sense of humor and likes to blow things up...BTW, he's also a coyote shift. As ATF, he's working together with other agencies in the coalition and is having the time of his life. Jade is smart, tough and NOT a shifter. Unlike the FBI she works for, she is more accepting of shifters and has a curiosity about them then. Together they make a couple that I found very entertaining to read. Actually all the characters in the coalition are great. I can't even call them secondaries because they all seem very front and center and play very important roles. There was plenty of action and suspense to keep me from putting this book down. Great world building in this Shifter Chronicles series yet I have found the books also work well as stand-alones. I found that with this coalition building of combining different organizations, and different shifter types together, author Crissy Smith has created a great series that everyone into PNR book will thoroughly enjoy.So I now have a few Crissy Smith books under my belt and I got to say, she is simply wonderful. I can't believe I haven't discovered this goldmine of a author before. Her talent in creating shifters, their interactions, suspense and sense of humor in her books is something I look for in every PNR I read. Anyone who isn't reading her, should be. I can't wait to read more of her works.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 5, Flames - 3

Dragon Fall starts off fairly interesting. Its starts with a date, a ring, a murder (of sorts) and a two year trip to a mental institution for our heroine Aoife. Once she gets out, Aoife is determine to get her life back on track. That is until a dog and a stranger end up in her lap. Turns out the dog isnt just a dog but a demon and he can talk. And that stranger, is hot, hunky and, oh yes, a dragon. A moody black dragon to be exact. Turns out everything she was locked up for is true and she has to deal with it. Plenty of twist, turns and humor, keep this crazy ride going along. Hello Alice, I think you have discovered another wacky hole to fall into. So many twist and turns in this story keep it rolling along. Kostya has a few issues hes dealing with and he does NOT want a mate. Aoife has to come to grips with the reality she was told wasnt real, really is. Jim is a hoot as our demon/dog and his lack of filter is very entertaining. The adventure these two take to try to break the dragons curse is fraught with mishaps and hilarious discussions. Through in a cast of likable secondary characters and what you have is a good start to what promises to be a fun series.As much fun as I had reading Dragon Fall I have a few bones to pick. One, despite this being book one in the lack Dragons, I cant help but feel Im walking into the middle of the series, Theres a familiarity between some of the characters that Im not getting. If this a spin-off series a little warning would have been nice. Two, normally I like a book that can make me laugh but in this instance, there was almost a bit too much silliness for me. Obviously, Jim was the comic relief here. A demon that chooses his form to be a big dog - yup fun stuff, and the lack of filter was downright hysterical. I think the issue is I couldn't quite tell if all the humor was intended. Some of the parts that could have been serious got lost in the funnies and fell flat. Third, the ending. If I was reading a paperback I know when I hit the end I would have been flipping pages and comparing notes with other copies of the book because the ending was a bit abrupt. It certainly felt like I was missing something even though there was a HEA. Could that have been a intended cliffhanger?Despite my issues, this was a pretty good book and I did enjoy it. I think I may do some investigating into Ms. MacAlisters other series and see if I can get up to speed before the next book in the Black Dragons comes out. Maybe after reading some of her other books Ill get my AHA! moment. As for my recommendation, I say sure go ahead and read it. It has dragons. I mean come on, who doesnt like dragons!I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3.5, Flames - 3

Oh my! Eve Langlais has done it again with When A Beta Roars. This second entry into the A Lion's Pride had me laughing from the very beginning. Hayder is quite the hoot and quite the ladies man. He's unfortunately tasked with babysitting a woman, which he thinks is way below his lofty Beta status. Arabella is a widowed wolf. Abused and beaten down by her previous mate, suddenly she a hot commodity by the members of her pack. Maybe it has something to do with her now being rich, and whoever gets her not only gets to be Alpha but they get her buckets of money as well. A wolf and a lion as mates is a pretty funny thought but when you throw into the mix that she's allergic to cats, HILARIOUS! Poor Hayder, she's sneezing all over him all the time. *Snickers!* However, he's willing to put up with it and all her timidness because with one look he knew his bachelor and catting around days were over. Instant mate connection!Between all her sneezing and constant threat of being snatched away by greedy wolves, there's a entertaining story. Big mighty Beta, the whipped wolf and how they change each other. She learns to be stronger, standing up for herself and him...okay all he really does is put his catting days behind him. They have a few escapades along the way (dinner, kidnapping, allergies) while Hayder proves he's quite the gentleman (Purr! Oh wait, lions don't purr!) as he's willing to wait for Arabella to decide she wants him. That translates into not a whole lot of sex in this one. *Sad meow* However, they do get on to the dirty deed and when they do, it's delicious! And the HEA...RAWR!!The best part of any story is the characters and once again I got to experience the lionesses in the pride which provide some of the funniest moments for me. They sure know how to keep the males in their place. That is all but one; Leo the Omega, He's actually turned out to be my favorite character in the series and I can't begin to tell you how happy I am to see he gets his own book. Happy meow!Whenever I read a sad book that turns me into an emotional wreck, I know I can always turn to one of Eve Langlais' books to perk me right up. Her stories always get me laughing and have the funniest characters. The situations they find themselves in always leave me smiling. Anyone wanting something light and entertaining to read, needs to get When a Beta Roars.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 4.5, Flames - 3

Wow, just WOW! I've got quite the book hangover here after finishing Breaking. The difference between book one in this series, Falling, and Breaking is close to being like night and day. So much action and intrigue. But on the other hand, they are very similar since they both have lonely men desperately in need of love.Conrad was certainly not what I expected. After finishing Falling I really didn't like him. At. All. Then I see he's getting his own book. OooKaaay. Guess I better get over my dislike of him. And....Yeah turns out I did like him. I certainly get why he was such a jerkface to Malachi. It doesn't excuse him but at least I get him now. Archer starts out as a scary hot dude and moved into my still kinda scary but maybe more misunderstood hot dude. Oh yes, both this guys are broken, Alpha personalities and neither wants to give an inch. I'd like to say it was Deefor (Freaking funny name BTW!) that helps bridge the gap between them. Once I learned their secrets I just wanted to give them both hugs.The first half of the book I really enjoyed. There's a lot of walls these two have to conquer both together and individually not to mention then need to figure out who is trying to kill them. Then right around 50-55% into the story I started to check the page count because I didn't thing things were going to go too much further without getting drawn out into BoringVille. All of a sudden WHAM! Everything kicks into to high-octane excitement! Holy Twizzlers! I did NOT see that coming! And things just keep coming and now not only can I not put this book done I also can't devour it fast enough. Just when I think these can't get any better and things have finally got to start calming down, author Barbara Elsborg manages to kick it up even higher. YOWZA! I was, finally, able to calm down when I got to the end. The end, oh yeah, that ending. Was all I could have wished for. *Sigh*You know the hardest part about writing reviews? It's when a book gets you SO EXCITED! you want to shout to the world how good it is and talk details... and you can't because you would be giving the plot and all the spoilers away. Author Barbara Elsborg has taken me on one heck of a roller coaster ride. Up, down, calm stretch, then dropping me into screaming loopy-dee-loops. By the end I saw in such awe I wanted to jump on the ride called Breaking again. I'm I recommending this book? You betcha! This series just gets better and better. Please, oh please, let there be another book!I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 5, Flames - 3.5

My Obsession by Cassie Ryan was a great start to her new Club Desire series. Sandra grew up in a troubled home. To get away she heads out to NYC where she finds the BDSM scene much to her liking. That is until she ends up with the wrong Dom., an abusive one, a stalker one. To get away from him she returns to her hometown where she once again seeks out the BDSM world. There she finds a club more suited to her and discovers a Dom who is perfect for her. Brent grew up being bullied as a nerd. All throughout school, he was picked on. Now hes an adult and owns the hottest dungeon in Phoenix. Hes got it all except for a woman to call his own. The one day, the girl he dreamed about all through high school walked in his dungeon doors.I have mixed feeling about Brent. Let me start with I really enjoyed his character. I found him very sexy, smart and I would do him in a heartbeat. Hes come a long way from the abused nerd he was in high school. My problem is while he was very gentle to Sandra, I didnt find him to be a very strong Dom. My expectations of Doms tend to run on the very strong and dominant tside. I found him to be a bit more beta than alpha. Equally, I am questioning Sandras choices as being a sub. Im not getting the whole abused child wanting to be a sub thing as an adult. Both of them were head-scratchers to me but maybe this is what works for them.My personal issues aside with the MCs, I found this book to be a very good read. Theres lots of great secondary characters here that I enjoyed and look forward to see them get their own stories. In addition, theres a lot of sexy play and smooth dialog that gives this book a nice pacing. Equally good was the stalker hunting down Sandra. It certainly gives a new meaning to the title and added a very nice scary twist to the whole thing. Wrap it up all together and you have a book here worth reading.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3.5, Flames  4.5

Seeing The Love by Sofia Grey is a very sweet romance reads quick and is filled with swoon worth romance. Lucas is losing his sight but he's not letting that slow him down. Natalie was in a horrific car accident that has left her covered in scars. They both work for the same company and have a long distance working relationship for years. Neither know about each others conditions and they plan to keep it that way. When a chance to meet each other in person presents itself secrets will be revealed.Get ready to sigh and smile a lot. Lucas and Natalie are very sweet characters. Its easy to see how they are attracted to each other. Both are very self-conscience of what they consider their personal downfalls and both have been burned by previous loves. You would think a story about a man losing his sight hooking up with a woman covered in scars would come off being tacky and ironic, but the author has presented in a way that you are left feeling theyre soul mates. I really enjoyed their interactions as friends then moved into something more. As their secrets were exposed, all their vulnerabilities pulled at my heart. There are other little twists to their story that keep the story moving along at a good pace. And yes there is a very sweet, very satisfying HEA for these two.I expected a quick ready, which I got, but I didnt expect to enjoy it as much as I did. It was a nice break from all the heavy books Ive been reading lately. Seeing The Love by Sofia Grey is definitely a book worth reading.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3.5, Flames - 3

It's not often I give up reading a book. It takes a lot of factors to get me to stop reading a book. Too much/not enough info, bad plot, bad characters. Really, I will trudge through most anything thing, cover to cover, to give my honest opinion about a book. Sometimes it's me, sometimes it's the book. I think in the case of Castrato, it was me.I pretty much spent the first 40% of this book confused. There's a lot people that get introduced and of building up to the story but for me it was a bit jumpy and scattered. I just couldn't absorb and compartmentalize all of the what and who. I did like the characters, don't get me wrong here. I did find, for the most part, all the characters fairly interesting. And the premise of the story, from the blurb, was sound. I am a PNR fanatic; fangs and fur are my preferred reading so I actually looked forward to reading the book. I just couldn't get into it. Even going back and re-reading I found didn't help me. I really did want to know who the killer was and why. Maybe, if I kept going everything would have pulled itself together and I would have had my 'AHA' moment. I just couldn't force myself to keep going on.I just didn't get it. This is no fault of the author's, and what he has written was well done. A solid 3-Stars with the chance of moving up. The beginning of the book and the first murder was very riveting. Of all the characters I had read in Castrato, I found Nathan to be the most interesting.  But outside of that first murder and Nathan, my brain just kept shutting down. So for now, I'm putting Castrato down, and moving it into a possible into my 'be read maybe at a later date' pile. Who knows, maybe with time I'll be able to get into the story. For right now, I'm moving on.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3, Flames - 4

I was in the mood for something besides my go-to PNRs and standard contemporary readings. I read the blurb for Final Protocol, saw that is SciFi with dubious content and said what the heck. At 109 pages, I figured even if I didnt like the book, I wouldnt have to suffer very long. Turns out the book wasnt too bad. As a book about a killer, there isnt so much killing. Its more of shes letting her intended hits get away and bad things are going to happen. Then Gold dangles the proverbial carrot in front of her face: FREEDOM! She just needs to take on one more and then hell let her go. This final target isnt so easy to kill.Silence was a strangely interesting character. A reluctant killer and shes very good at it. Gold is the uber creepy guy that calls all the shots and abuses her in not-so-nice ways. That would be the dubious content there. Those of you who have rape and mind manipulation as a trigger, thats why Im giving this book 5-flames so read this book at your own risk. I kept wondering as her story unfolded, if shes such a great killer, why doesnt she just kill the sadistic bastard. Then that little nugget was explained, AHA, gotcha now. Bits and pieces of her story come out slowly at the beginning but once she goes after her final target who, no surprise is her lost love, the escalate very quickly to the end. There obviously more to the story than just that but as a short ready I dont want to give anything away. In a sense, Silence does get her happy ending, however, she is a killer and the only way shell be truly happy is to get her revenge on Gold.This is my first book by J.C. Daniels and it was fairly good. Final Protocol was a pretty quick read, with just enough content to keep the characters interesting and me entertained. The ending had enough of a cliffhanger to have me curious what Silence has in-store for Gold. Ill definitely be keeping my eye out for the next book.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars  3.5, Flames  5

Im not a fan of ghost stories. I dont like to be scared by things that go bump in the night so the fact that I signed up to read The Secret Casebook of Simon Feximal was completely out of the norm for me. To tell you the truth, I chose to read it because I liked the title. It was kind of quirky and I knew If I didnt at least discover what the title was about, I knew it would have bothered me for a while. And I really liked the book!I didnt realize it was a series of short stories about Robert and Simon collected to make one book. You see, Ive never read anything by K.J. Charles so I had no clue. Now I get it. The book is told completely from Roberts first person POV of his relationship and experiences he had with Simon. Not just hunting ghost but what they went through as two men involved during the Victorian era. Now, normally, I shy away from horror and ghosts because I prefer to not be freaked out. Frankly, after their first encounter, I realized this wouldnt be a uber scary story. Dont get me wrong, there is horror and evil, which doesnt all come from the dead, but Simons need to help ghosts seems to be more along the lines for good reasons. Some of the stories/chapters, are more fascinating than others although as I reach the end of each chapter, things would click into place the purpose behind them.Theres a interesting cast of secondary character that add a curious layer to the book. Ms. Kay had me scratching my head for the longest time. That is until her story came out. YIKES! There are others that, whenever they appeared I had mixed feeling about. For the most part, the evil ones were easy to detect and when they finally meet their end I was cheering. But then there were a few that I felt I almost should know who they were. The Fat Manis he a reference I should know or has the author created a character so sincere that I feel if I knew my British history better, I would know who he is?As Ive said before, this is my first book by K.J. Charles. I see she has a whole slew of books out with several of them about Simon and Robert. The Secret Casebook of Simon Feximal has struck me curious enough that I really want to read more about them, despite not liking ghost stories. I think its because in the end, I really enjoyed then. I think I will indulge in more of her books.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 4, Flames - 3

Angel Lover is one action packed adventure.It certainly was not what I expected. Frankly it was way better than I anticipated. The energy level I am buzzing on after finishing this book is through the roof.Wow, just, wow! If I was to use one word to describe Mariel and Kas story it would be unpredictable. So many twists and secrets here. There's so much to both of them, their background stories, how got to where they are now, that I felt I really was able to get to know them very well. Mariel is strong, fierce, and her story is heart-wrenching and shocking once everything is revealed. Kas is equally strong and as sad as his story is Mariel definitely comes out the unfortunate winner here. I really got into the to trust or not to trust dance they did around each other. And as hot as the sex was between them, I'm glad everything wasn't all lust driven. These are two warriors, to make them into smut bunnies would have ruined the story.There's lots of secondary characters that have peaked my interest, (Jarrid Cain, Tanis to name a few) I'm ready to find out more about. I missed out of the first books in the series so I'm walking in blind regarding the battle between the Renegades and Heaven. Easy enough to think it's about good angels and demons but this isn't the case here. It certainly provided a interesting twist to what has become to me standard angel stories. Right around the time I felt I had everyone and everything just figured out, who's good, who's bad, and what I expect to happen next, Curveball! I love when that happens. The only thing I predicted right was that Mariel and Kas would end up together. That and there had to be a epic battle which there always is one when good and evil clash. But that's okay because it offered up the right amount of violence this bloodthirsty reader likes. Now Mariel and Kas do get their HEA however, I get the feeling this series doesn't end here because, TA-DAH! there's a cliffhanger. Not one that is going to drive me bonkers but enough that I am ready to find out what happens next to {BEEP}. Oh sorry, not telling. You'll have to read to find out for yourself.This is my very first book by Tricia Skinner and let me say it now, I AM HOOKED! The only problem is I am starting at book 2 instead of book 1. I keep jumping into these great series in the middle instead of at the beginning. I really need to change that pattern up because I missing that introduction every series seems to have. But that's not a problem since I want, no NEED, to read Angel Assassins series. Lovers of Angels stories that aren't of the fluffy white harp playing variety are going to love this series. Get it now!I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 5, Flames - 3

I hopped into the series in the middle of it and knowing what I do now, I have GOT to start it from the beginning if for noting else this series ROCKS! Undying Hunger was so hard to put down.Alexandria and Markus are quite the exciting couple. They have one of those how-could-you, what-happens-next, forgive-him, swoon, kick-his-butt, yes! romances that I oh so love to read. She hates him, she has so many reasons to and yet, wants him. Markus, oh boy. He's such a vampire in quite the conundrum. He was good, then did bad, and is now trying to come out of the dark. I'm not sure why he turned Alexandria in the first place as I missed reading the first few books in the series but I totally get why he wants and desires her now. As their story unfold, I found myself cheering them on and booing everyone against them. Yes this includes all the good guys. I'm a sucker for rogue redemption and the journeys they take to their happy ending. I also like a story that is filled with action and intrigue which there was no shortage from here.The majority of the secondary characters we have already met in previous titles. I always like series that carry over their characters. They feel like old familiars friends and getting to experience them a second, third, fourth time around always gets me excited. There is a new player this time, Christian. I had mixed feeling about him in the beginning and really didn't think much of him. By the end, I was singing a new tune. Now I hoping he gets his own book. Please, please, please let there be another book with his name all over it. PLEASE!If you're looking for a great vampire romance with lots of action to since your teeth into, then let it be The Enclave series by Jessica Lee. Those one is worth reading again and again.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 5, Flames - 3.5

Well that was certainly a good book. Carnal Risk was a exciting read. The beginning chapter had my jaw on the floor and all the exciting adventures pretty much kept it there.Usually somewhere along the lines I will find myself annoyed with MCs in the story. This isn't the case here. Garrett and Selby were two very likable characters. Despite Garrett being a billionaire he comes off as being very down to earth. Selby is very intelligent and, despite her many phobia issues, a very tough lady. It's very obvious that there is a instant attraction between them. Their interactions in and out of the bedroom are highly entertaining. Who knew almost drowning from surfing could be a aphrodisiac!Now before you think this is just another romance, there a mystery to solve as well. Someone has murdered Garrett's close friend and co-worker, Evan, the reasons why have yet to be discovered. Selby is brought in to help cover for and find a replacement for Evan. There's quite a bit of intrigue on guess the whodunit. Was it one of the many great secondary characters? Why was he killed? So many questions to be answered. I kept flipping back and forth on who was the killer and then... GASP! No way! I didn't see that coming. Quite the shocker let me tell you.I fell in love with Kym Grosso's PNR story and have been recommending her books for a while. The first book in her new contemporary romance series, Club Altera, is shaping up to be just as good. Anyone looking for a author who can multitask in several genres, needs to be reading Ms. Grosso. Now I've reached the hard part in a series, waiting for the next book!I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine.Stars - 4, Flames - 4

I had such fun with this book! Dying to Date was fun and flirty with edge of intrigue from start to finish. At times I found myself giggling, others I was biting my nails.Melissa is a vampire socialite however thankfully I did not find her to be a snob. Maybe a bit grumpy, but who can blame her when shes dying to find a date (Get the title!). So she tries her hand at a dating service for supernatural. Shes not getting any matches until... Tarian has been around a VERY long time and he is looking for a mate. Necromancers arent exactly welcome in the supernatural world, so keeping his background on the down-low he tries out the same dating agency as well. Its attraction at first sight. And so the adventure begins!I found Dying to Date a hoot from the very beginning. Melissas situation as the dateless I found to be entertainingly funny. When Tarian walks in you can tell there is some serious va-va-va-voom between them. The dialog on their date was snappy and fun. And then Tarians family has to go in and ruin it by kidnapping her. Now things got real fun as Tarian goes for the rescue and the rush across the country to get back to her family to stop a war. The adventures they had along the way were some of the best parts for me. The ending was all I wanted it to be and more. Now the question is, will there be another book in this Fated Match series and who is it going to be about? Cant wait to find out!This is my first book by Victoria Davies and what a delightful treat it was. It had the right amount of sass, danger and heat to keep me entertained the whole way through. I missed reading book #1 in this series and if it is as much fun as Dying to Date was, then I will need to rectify that immediately. Very much a recommended read for lovers of fun PNRs.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine.Stars - 5, Flames - 3

It's not often I get to indulge in a SciFi romance. Most I have come across are all about the boinking and I like my stories to have a bit more substance. Which is why I was completely delighted with Roark by Jacqueline Rhoades.Godan warriors have been at war with the Hahnshin for a thousand years. Their current battleground is Earth and the people on the planet have been paying the price for six long years. The survivors are doing all they can to stay alive. While this premise is not an original one, it's one that usually works for me especially if I can engage with the characters. Mira and Roark, Oh yes, I liked them a lot. Mira is such a tough woman doing what she can to keep her family going. Roark is all male and strong, even when he goes all caveman I still found him sexy. The heat between them was a nice perfect simmer. Things can't run all smooth for them and as the story progress we find out both are harboring some fairly powerful secrets. Hers was easy to guess them but his...yeah didn't see that coming. They do eventually work things out, although not without some serious issues, but in the end their HEA was a perfect, and surprising one.This isn't just all romance between these pages. Their survival, action, intrigue and some giggling moments as the Godan solders get educated in the fine art of English and human women. Not sure there was a intent of humor in those classes but I found some of them funny. The cast of secondary characters were simply a delight. Mason, Ahnyis, Mohawk, just to name a few, had me smiling and cheering them on. I hope as this series continues we get to see more of them.I've been a fan of Ms. Rhoades' Wolvers series and this is my first taste of her book outside of that world. I'm really enjoying this bite and plan on sampling her other books. Anyone who wants to try SciFi without all the extra tentacles and eyes needs to read Roark. Lovers of SciFi are going love it, too.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 5, Flames - 3

I'm sure by now you've read the blurb for Rush and wanted to know what it's about. Let me break it down for you. Hot boy meets plain Jane girl, sees something special in the girl, decides to help her out, they fall in love and live happily ever after. Sounds simple right? Only this boy is heir to the biggest adult entertainment film maker in Canada. He's also VP and one of his duties is screening the talent. The girl is a heartbeat away from finishing school to become a lawyer. And what does she need help with? A bucket list of to do's left by her grandmother.Let's start with Everly. Plain, smart, studious. Mom's a lawyer, dad's a lawyer. You can pretty much guess why she is on the track to becoming a lawyer. Everly's grandmother passed away leaving her not only her house but a bucket list of things to do before she finishes school. Things to loosen her up, to live life. Little things like date someone you wouldn't give the time of day to. Queue Max's entrance. Hot, rich, cocky. He's whole life has been about the porn industry. Mom was a porn star, dad is the president. Sole heir to his parents' dynasty, groomed to take over for his dad, but he feels something is missing. Everly and Max: Two opposites yet so the same.I love this book! What a plot. It really wasn't what I expected. I thought what with the porn I was going to reading something sleazy. Instead, it was fun, exciting and had me laughing. The adventures Max takes Everly on to take complete her bucket list I couldn't get enough of. Dont expect shallow one dimensional characters here. With dueling 1st person POVs we really get to experience their thought and emotions, all their insecurities and desires laid bare for us as we take a wild ride with them to their journey to a HEA. One that they want to live and not chosen for them. Along the way we get to meet a host of secondary characters that you can help but like and want to know more about. I laughed, I cried but mostly I devoured their story in one sitting, Yep, Rush is one of those books that I stayed up until the wee hours of the morning reading because I could not put it down. If I had one complaint about this book that it isnt a series. I would love to see Bens and Graces futures.As my first book by Gina Gordon I keep asking myself why I haven't discovered her before. Her ability to write a hot story and still keep it fun is simply amazing. I can't wait to read more of her books. As for reasons why you should read Rush, I'll give you five.1. The bucket list2. Study incentives3. Levin Accomplishment Room4. Vagina molds5. Porn has never been this funny.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 5, Flames - 4

Eye of the Tiger is my first book by author Crissy Smith. I walked in with no expectations but I'm coming away with needing more. This book read hot quick and loaded with what I like - Action, excitement and adventure.What really sold me on this book are the characters. From the main to the secondary, I found them all a pleasant surprise. Zak and Abilene are the main ones and they immediately had me cheering them on. Throw in Jaime, Cody and Luca, who are all amazeballs. The intricate interacting between all the characters definitely makes this story. But thats not all. They are all working in an investigation that kept this story moving quickly. Now, what would a shifter story be without some heat? There are several scenes between Zak and Abilene that are steamy hot and wildly explosive. Of course, there was also a few that had me giggling ICE! Hee-hee!!Starting in the middle of a series sometimes can be a hot mess, especially if you needed backstories to understand. This is not the case here. Eye of the Tiger works great as a stand-alone and am throwing it in my recommended pile. Although, given how much I enjoyed Cody and Jaime, I backtracked to see what the first books in the series were about. And what do you know, there are my two favorite shifters starting in their own books. I am definitely, going to be checking them out.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 4, Flames - 3

Hotness. Only at the Cavern is simply hotness. And exciting. Did I mention it was hot, too? In all seriousness, I thoroughly enjoyed this latest installment in the Heroes of Saturn series. Almost all the other books have the main characters as being the actual folks from Saturn finding their soul mates. Honestly, after the last book I didn't honestly know how the series would go on. However, some of the secondaries were interesting enough (Thank Goodness!) to keep this series.Captain Marco DeWinter. I really didn't think much about him before but now... Mmmm! And Jasmine is smoking sexy. She is a smart, brilliant doctor use to giving orders. At The Cavern, watch out subs. No kittenish Domme here. She's all woman - knows what she wants and how she wants it. The dynamics between them both professionally and sexually were quite the treat. Normally I don't read Domme/sub books but Marco and Jasmine really made it work for me.Running in the background is a case that Marco had been working on for quite some time. Scary dude that among other things is into trafficking women. While Marco is trying to nail the case and put the bad guy away, he's trying to sort through being a sub and wanting a relationship with Jasmine, who has a few issues of her own. Action and adventure in and out of the bedroom...oh yeah! Throw in a visit from past characters plus a few new ones (Cassidy needs his own book...JS) and I was loving every bit of it.I've been addicted to this series from the very beginning. Only at The Cavern is a definite recommendation from me. Anna Alexander has created quite a few characters that you just can't help but adore and I'm sure once you start reading this series, you'll understand why. So grab yourself a copy and enjoy the ride.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 4, Flames - 4

I have now read five out of seven books in this series and I have to say, Ghost's Treasure is my favorite. It has something that I found lacking in the previous books - real suspense and intrigue. I know that sounds harsh but when you read a series about 'warriors' and read the blurb describing what the Wind Warriors are all about, you expect action, intrigue and suspense. When it goes missing or plays a very minor role in the story, it can be very disappointing.The story begins with Josie rummaging through a box of book she purchased at a estate sale. Little does she know and much to her surprise, she stumbles upon a hidden treasure. Not know if it is real, she sends emails out to museums to determine what she actually has in her possession. Next thing you know, people are after her to get the priceless treasures she has. Not knowing what to do, she goes to the FBI for help. From there things start getting interesting. The FBI assigns her a bodyguard to protect her until all the evil players are rounded up and taken care of. All the action and intrigue surrounding the lost treasure and the means Ghost takes to protect Josie is what I loved the most. It kept the story moving at a great pace what with not knowing what was going to happen next.There is, of course, the romance that develops between Ghost and Josie. Ghost has his own tragic story and ghost of his past that haunts him. Josie is no dumb blond and is actually a fun character. The fact that she is a biathlon athlete and was raised around guns keeps her from being a shrinking violet when all the dangerous chaos ensues. Lots of surprising twist and turns as they deal with the bad guys and we get a revisit with all the previous Wind Warriors, which in a series, is always a nice plus for me. Things do heat up between them, thankfully well after the danger has all passed, and has a nice slow progression and ends in a sweet HEA.So this is the seventh book in the series and I'm not sure if there will be more. I know for me it will be my last. Over-all this is not a bad series and I'm sure there will be many readers who will enjoy and appreciate what it has to offer. I personally enjoy a book that has a lot more action. Although, I found the stories a bit repetitive, Cheyenne Meadows does do a good romance and I'm sure fans of hers will enjoy this series.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3, Flames - 3

Silver Spoon is the fifth book in the Wind Warrior series and it's about my favorite character in the series so far. Which of course means I have very high expectations for this book. I think I may have set the bar too high. Hmm...As romance goes this one is fairly good. Lots of emotions between the two main characters, Riley and Spoon. In the previous books enjoyed Spoon's personality and found his wit and comments  very humorous and was hoping for more of that. Sadly, the Spoon in this book did not meet my expectations. He had came off more angsty . Nevertheless less, their story as it unfolds is sweet and as they discover each other secrets they find they have quite a bit in common. Romance blooms between Spoon and Riley while they struggle through challenges life throws their way. There's appearances from the characters from the previous books and everything ends in a nice neat little package.Here's my problem with this book and the entire series. I have now read four out of the five books and they all feel like I am reading the same book. Each book has a big dog that was either adopted as a rescue or was found and rescued. Almost all the characters have parent issues. All but one of the lead women was a virgin. Almost all the men to blow off steam after a assignment were man-whores but meeting that special woman has completely changed them in a blink of an eye. When there is action/assignment that the Warriors have to attend to, their thoughts are always on that special person, how they may die, can't be with them and other angsts. There's more but I think I've made my point. While the stories are all nice, have HEA and no cliffhangers, there is a very set pattern and formula that each book has to contain. This might work for other readers but I like variety. I don't want to feel like I'm reading the same book over and over. I want each book to feel uniquely different. Unfortunately, for me, each book was too dj vu for me to enjoy.Over-all, this is a nice romance. It has a nice flow, sexual heat and a HEA. Anyone likes to read books with that combination will enjoy Silver Spoon.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3, Flames - 3

I didn't think it was possible but Ms. Phoenix has outdone herself with this latest Brie book.In this latest installment, Master send Brie on errand that has me gasping for air. What? No...not possible! But just when I get over that first shock there a even bigger one on the horizon I DID NOT SEE COMING! Talk about kicking up that WOW! bar of shock up a few notches. Brie handles it all in her own fashion that shows you how far she's come and how mature she is from those early days of submissive training. Of course this errand isn't the only one Brie is asked to assist in. There's more that had me laughing so hard I had to stop reading before I could continue. Smooshed between all these gasp out loud moments is some delicious times with Master. I never get tired of those.Now grab yourself a copy, sit back and enjoy the ride. And most importantly, be prepared to be wowwed,

Dark Instincts is my first introduction to The Phoenix Pack series. I missed out on the first three books so I walked into this series blind not knowing the plot or characters. The very beginning I was good with and definitely sparked my interest. As more and more characters came into play I began to get confused and lost. Obviously, reading the first four books would have helped understand who was who as well as the different packs. For that handicap alone I would suggest reading the previous books. Once I got pass the first several chapters I got into the swing of things.I love Roni! First off, she is a very strong character. I like my lead women to be strong and she totally fit the bill. She also has the quirky coping devices, lollipops and sharing the weirdest trivia facts that I found simply delightful. Marcus is hubba-hubba hot! Everybody thinks hes an all charming man-whore. Theres so much more to him than that. The two of them together was pure entertainment for me. But deep down inside they have their reasons for their actions and it was so much fun watching them break each others walls down. Besides Roni and Marcus, theres a whole cast of characters that I thoroughly enjoyed. I think I need to go back and read their booksNow besides Roni and Marcus hooking up, theres a whole other story going on. Its filled with wolf and jackal shifters, which I have read plenty of ones with wolves but this is my first with jackals. I found the jackals to be of the stereo typical type you would find in the Lion King but hey, it still worked for me. Lots of action and mystery surrounding the between the different shifters that kept this story rolling along very well. Between the quick, snappy dialog and the who-done-its, I found myself devouring this book as fast as I could. I may have predicted that Roni and Marcus would have ended up together but the journey they were on and the mysteries that needed to be solved, I was pleasantly surprised. Of course everything ends in a fun HEA without and cliffhangers.Author Suzanne Wright may have a new fan in me. I really enjoyed her story telling. She has quite the way of keeping a story going as well and putting together some very interesting characters. This certainly will not be my last book of hers. Ill be recommending, this book, this series and this author to anyone looking for their next great PNR to lose themselves in.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars  4.5, Flames - 3

Sky's Lark, book four in the Wind Warrior series so far has been my favorite. I enjoy books more when the women are strong characters. Lark certainly fits the bill. As the sole woman on the Wind Warrior team she needs to be one tough, smart cookie and she is. Bryce, aka Sky, is fairly tough, too. Together then make a great team. Things definitely heat up between the two and, unlike the previous books, Lark is not a virgin so I had an easier time accepting them hopping into bed. Now normally I don't mind the first kiss in the book between the characters but in this instance I find myself very irritated. For a very smart woman, I cannot understand why she would kiss a complete random stranger that approaches her in a dark parking lot. Personally I would be running or defending myself, and I certainly would not find myself interested in said stranger. That kiss alone pretty much ruins the story for me.The first have of the book was really exciting and filled with action that kept the story moving at a great pace. I like it when a story is filled with secrets and actions. It keeps me on my toes. Right around the middle I felt the story dragged a bit but then perked up in the end. We get more exposure to the rest of the Wind Warrior team, which as a whole, I really enjoy. Still finding my favorite to be Spoon of all the warriors although altogether they make a interesting group.Each book in the series that I have read have worked out just fine as stand-alones. Sky's Lark is no exception to that rule, despite having past and future characters. From the very beginning Spoon has been my favorite character. His book is next and I'm dying to dive into it.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3, Flames - 3

How can you pass up a blurb that contains '1-800-GHOST-HUNK'? I certainly couldn't and I'm glad I didn't. Must Love Ghosts by Jennifer Savalli was such a fun read. This short quirky story was exactly what I needed.Dec is a hubba-hubba ghosthunter, excuse me, paranormal investigator. Tia is a 'almost engaged' professor determined to prove love is nothing more than a biochemical cocktail. But once upon a time they were a hot and heavy item. When strange things started happening in her home she immediately assumed Dec was behind her trouble. With Dec's help she finds out what is going on. Turns out her problem is actually more of a after-life issue - an after-life with a sense of humor! The story starts out quick paced and carries that way straight through to the end. Lot's of snappy dialog and humorous antics from they dead keep this story moving along. On occasion I had an urge to shake Tia, but she does redeem herself. With the of exception of Richard I enjoyed all the quirky characters. The ending wasn't too surprising but I still enjoyed it.As my first book by author Jennifer Savalli, I must say it was very satisfying. Looking forward to seeing where she goes with this series. Anyone who is in the markets for a fun read with ghosts if going to enjoy Must Love Ghosts.I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 3, Flames - 2

I'm not going to lie. I expected a romance. I'm not going to say this is the furthest thing from a romance since there were a few heated moments, but that certainly didn't not make this book a romance. Instead, The City Beneath is more of a paranormal, suspense mystery.Surprisingly, I actually enjoyed this book. I tend to be drawn to vampire stories that really don't have much variety to them. The formula that I fall for is the usual girl meets vamp, vamp is all angsty, girl is in danger, vamp caves, turns her and they live HEA. This really wasn't the case here. Rarely do I see a author come up with a new twist to this old vampire story formula. Not the case here. Ms. Johnson has managed to introduce a new way of creating vampires. Night bloods, and that's what Cassidy is. She's also a nosy journalist which of course lands her smack dab in trouble. Trouble being a vampire rebellion. Vampire rebellions are not original however I found the plot line regarding night bloods a refreshing change from the typical bite-suck-your a vamp conversion.Over-all, The City Beneath was fun for me. The dialog was snappy, the characters engaging, and the plot line, even though not too original (hello vamp rebellion!), I still enjoyed. The lack of romantic entanglements instead of detracting from the story, actually added to it. I could relax and absorb all the action and mystery without being to concern that things were going to turn hot and heavy at the most inopportune moments. Even though there's a nice mystery feel to the whole plot, the dialog between characters still had moments of getting me to chuckle.Too many mystery movies have me guessing the the whodunit from the get go so I wasn't exactly too surprised when the 'dunt dunt dunt' reveal happened. Guessing from early on and having my thoughts confirmed didn't detract from the story. Actually, if anything, it made it more interesting. I didn't know the why and when I did find out...light bulb. I got it now. The ending was all I liked and more. I'm finding myself excited and anticipating what happens next, which is rare for me. Not being a mystery fan usually I am over it quickly once all the cards have been played. But in this instance, I can't wait to find out what happens next. Well played Ms. Johnson!I received this book from the JeepDiva for the express purposes of an honest review. The opinions and rating of this review are solely mine and in no way was I compensated.Stars - 4, Flames - 2

After round two of lice plague (thanks preschool) I didn't want to have to resort to pesticide shampoos that lice are becoming resistant to anyway and opted to give this bad boy a try. This comb is big enough to fit comfortably in the hand while trying to remove nits, and my gosh it works! It took only one thorough pass through with this comb to rid a kid with thick semi-curly hair of all the creepy crawlies. No pesticide shampoo needed, and no need for multiple sessions though we made it a point to check every couple of days for about a week and a half after. We were able to rinse off the comb when done with no rust after the fact. It did not appear to pull or tear our child's hair, however someone with particularly long and thick hair may have difficulty being thorough because you can only pass through a little hair at a time. Ultimately worth every penny to defeat the lice plague in our house.

The madagascar bourbon vanilla is amazing! There is so much vanilla bean in it the syrup almost looks muddy. The resulting flavor is rich, fragrant, and authentic vanilla flavor. I use this to make cinnamon roll flavored drinks like a certain major coffee chain's at home and it does not disappoint! (Vanilla syrup, cinnamon dolce syrup, and white mocha.) The syrup arrived in a nice box which included the pump, a booklet with recipes and product information as well as a coupon on other Amoretti products. I have purchased a few Amoretti syrups in the past and this is by far the best I've had. I would definitely purchase it again!

I've ordered a few Amoretti syrups at this point and the cinnamon is the only disappointing one I've received. If you're looking for a syrup that tastes like someone mixed freshly ground cinnamon and simple syrup you will be disappointed. This syrup tastes like someone melted a bunch of red hot candies and even a 1/2 pump was enough to completely overwhelm a 12oz coffee. One star off for the artificially flavored candy taste. The syrup also arrived wrapped in plastic and dented up pretty badly. When I have ordered the syrups from other vendors on Amazon they arrived in nice Amoretti boxes which included a recipe booklet and coupon, this did not have the original Amoretti packaging but did, thankfully, include the pump. Lack of original packaging and dented up as a result: loss of a second star. Would I purchase other Amoretti premium syrups? Absolutely! Would I repurchase the cinnamon one? Not at all. You're better of just putting actual ground cinnamon in your drink.

The material is soft and the color is exactly as advertised, however the quality is very poor. The pictures that several customers have posted of torn sheets is exactly the experience we have had. The only reason for the 2 stars is because we did manage to get about a year of occasional use out of them before they tore completely down the side of the sheet(s) rendering them useless. You get what you pay for with these, they're cheap for a reason. The only reason I would consider repurchasing these is for an inexpensive guest bed set that would mostly sit around in a closet. The hand sized tears in the sheets were the result of normal use and normal washing.

The fit is as expected. The colors on the design are vibrant and exactly as pictured. The shirt is a sturdy Hanes cotton tee. Despite ordering in an XXL for the intended recipient the design does not feel too small for the shirt, unlike some shirt makers that use a design that seems intended for an XS shirt regardless of the actual shirt size. I would purchase this again, and the person that received the shirt loved it.

These are a lifesaver. These fit our large van ness litter box beautifully and even though our cat digs like crazy the bag stays intact enough we can lift out the litter without causing a mess. The sturdiness of the bags make changing litter so much less of a chore and I wish I had known about these sooner! They are pretty much just a simple trashbag that is wide and long rather than tall and deep.

Scottish breakfast tea is wonderful stuff if you're used to being a coffee drinker. We initially purchased this to help wean us off of our coffee habit. Scottish breakfast tea has about 2/3 the amount of caffeine of a regular cup of coffee. This tea is a hearty black tea that manages to still shine through added milk and has a bit of a slightly malty flavor. We love it enough we went from ordering a single pack to a six pack. No more coffee for us!

This is easily my favorite popping corn. When using an air popper very little went unpopped. They kernels were just heavy and large enough they weren't shooting out of the popper before actually popping which often happened with the purple corn I had purchased before. This pops nice and fluffy and what I'd call a medium size. It is smaller than white/yellow corn and larger than the very dainty purple corn. The flavor is mild, and the slightest bit nutty. It is also really nice that the hard pieces of the hull that get stuck in your teeth pretty much disappear upon popping. Out of three large batches I had exactly one piece that got stuck in the teeth. I would, and intend to, purchase this again.

This is so comfortable! It fits exactly as expected and is pretty much just an oversized cotton tank top. The removal of a star is for the lack of length. I'm only 5'6 and this easily shows the bottom of the cheeks without having to bend down. If you're taller this may end up being more like a tunic length tank top than a chemise. That being said it is super comfortable and I love lounging around in it on a lazy day and have purchased more than one.

This lipstick was true to color and a nice, rich red. Of all the lipsticks I've tried this has had the most staying power next to Revlon's "Bitten" however that was more of a stain than a lipstick. This lipstick also stained the lips a bit to a point where I wasn't able to remove it all by the next day, but it would need to be touched up a little after eating/drinking/kissing, etc. It went on easily and stayed nice and velvety unlike some long wear lipsticks which have a tendency to dry up and crack. I would definitely buy this again and will likely purchase in more colors.

After years of using the regular cajun seasoning by McCormick we opted to give the bayou cajun mix a try and I'm glad we did. First off, this is pretty much exactly the seasoning used on Five Guys' Cajun fries. I like that although it does have some salt in the mix, it isn't overwhelmingly salty at all like original Slap Ya Mama or Tony Chachere's Creole Mix. This blend is really mild when it comes to cajun seasoning heat, but it is by far one of the most flavorful cajun spice mixes I've tried and I would and will buy it again. It is great on fries, fish, and chicken, or mixed with mayo to make a sandwich spread.Ingredients as they appear on the bottle: Garlic, Spices, Salt, Onion, Paprika, and Red Pepper

I've used a couple of different brands of protein power in the past and they always ended up with a horrible chemical aftertaste. After some digging around for other options I decided to give whey isolate a try instead since isolate has less lactose and fat in addition to not having the sweeteners and artificial flavorings that regular protein powders have. Since I've had good experiences buying from BulkSupplements in the past, I opted to go with theirs and I wasn't disappointed.The isolate fresh out of the bag is a bit grittier than non-isolate whey powders but it dissolves much more easily in liquids. I'm also happy to report it doesn't have the nasty aftertaste either. Others have described the aftertaste of the isolate as "slightly milky" and that is quite accurate but it is subtle enough it doesn't overpower. The serving size of 30 grams translates to two tablespoons of powder and each serving has 27 grams of protein. The only ingredients per the package are diary derived whey protein isolate and soy lecithin used to emulsify.All-in-all it was a great purchase and I will buy this again. It is perfect for mixing in smoothies and yogurt to give them an extra protein boost.

After an allergic reaction to deodorants with aluminum I opted to give this a try. While it says "unscented" there's orange oil in it that gives it a light citrus scent that actually smells kind of like lemon bars.Since it is not an antiperspirant you will still sweat, but deodorants are supposed to at the very least mask the scent. Arm & Hammer actually does use triclosan which is an antibacterial, and since bacteria is the real reason for BO it does in fact help with stinky pits. For someone that's a mild to moderate sweater, this deodorant does its job and no BO is/was present at the end of the day. So for that reason, it is OK.For the people that have stated they got burning/peeling/rashes under their arms, that can actually be a sign of a sensitivity to an ingredient, or even an outright allergy to one of the ingredients. That is why I tried this product in the first place, because I had that kind of reaction to aluminum based products. So, if you're having a reaction you may want to consider seeing an allergist.As for the triclosan: Triclosan is a product that keeps bacteria under control. (Hence its use in deodorant.) While studies are not showing it to be dangerous to humans, some have shown it to be dangerous to the animal models tested. While animal models can in many ways demonstrate what to expect in humans, they do not always match. So some things that negatively affect the animal models because of their unique biology don't necessarily affect us because of our unique biology, or at least not in exactly the same way. Until research indicates we are potentially being affected negatively too it is considered safe for humans to use. But, knowing that there's a bit of a grey area means some will refuse to use it and others won't. http://www.fda.gov/ForConsumers/ConsumerUpdates/ucm205999.htmAll-in-all it does work ok. If it were a particularly hot day, or if you are particularly sweaty you may need to re-apply it.If you're wanting totally all natural and/or triclosan free then you'd want to avoid it.If you're allergic/sensitive to any of the following ingredients you'd also want to avoid it: Dipropylene Glycol, Water, Propylene Glycol, Sodium Stearate, Sodium Bicarbonate (Baking Soda), Anthemis Nobilis (Camomile) Flower Oil, Coriandrum Sativum (Coriander), Fruit Oil, Pelargonium Graveolens (Geranium) Flower Oil, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Triethyl Citrate, Triclosan, Tetrasodium EDTA, Allantoin.

Ingredients: refinery syrup, and honey.With refinery syrup as the primary ingredient it means what you're getting has more non-honey than actual honey. So calling it granulated honey is kind of misleading in that regard. Also note: Refinery sugar is the byproduct of cane sugar refining, it is NOT corn syrup.I've ordered several products from Hoosier Hill Farm in the past and all of them were excellent but this is one that has been a disappointment when taking into consideration what is advertised versus what you get. (*It appears the ingredients are now updated on amazon because it used to just say honey.) I wanted honey powder for a spice mix/rub and could even have dealt with the fact that it is mostly non-honey if at the very least the honey flavor was strong. This tastes exactly like you'd expect of a sugar/honey blend. It primarily tasted like cane sugar with a bit of honey on the back end instead of a strong honey taste. This is obviously disappointing when you were at the very least expecting a strong honey flavor but instead get something only moderately honey flavored.That being said, why the 3 stars? It still gets three stars instead of one because at the end of the day it can still be used as a sweetener for various things that maybe just need a little honey flavor. Blending this with some cloves and a pinch of salt will make for an excellent ham rub, or mixing it with some savory spices for a BBQ rub will create a unique flavor I would not get from just using regular white or brown sugar. You could also run it through a grinder or processor to get the consistency of powdered sugar if you had a recipe that called for powdered sugar but needed a little extra something flavor wise. (I imagine in powdered form it would make a wonderful lightly honey flavored buttercream.) So, it is still usable as an alternative sweetener and there's just enough of a honey taste at the end to warrant a three star rating, but it ultimately wasn't what I was looking for.

This has been a good, and versatile powder for adding to green smoothies, scrambled eggs, making an easy vegetable based broth, and sneaking into meatloaf and other foods so no one suspects you've made it a little more nutritious. Note that it can be strong and a bit bitter like its fresh counterpart so a little goes a long way. For green smoothies I've found that 1/2-1tsp is more than enough and it pairs well with matcha green tea powder and a frozen "banana bread ripe" banana to make a green tea flavored green smoothie that is just sweet enough to offset kale's bitterness. (Honey works too if you like things sweeter.) Since a little goes such a long way, there's enough uses in each container that I do feel as though it is money well spent and I would order it again. In fact, I'm thinking about giving some of their other vegetable powders a try since I've also enjoyed their mushroom powder in the past. I would purchase again.***Note about how powder compares to fresh:A little bit of helpful information regarding the nutrition label on the container: 1tsp = about 4-5 grams, note that in the image of the nutrition label they have the serving as 100g which if assuming 5g per tsp is a little over 1/2 c of powder per serving. So, if you want to know the %DV of the nutrients, or the calories per tsp serving, a good rough estimate is taking the number on the label and dividing by 20. (So, approximately 17.8 calories per tsp, 53.8% DV of vitamin A per tsp, etc.) If we're looking at macronutrients 1 tsp = approximately 1/2 c fresh kale. Reasoning: Using the ~5g per tsp there would be approximately 1g protein per tsp which would be the same as about 1/2 c of fresh kale, and 0.65g fiber per 1/2c fresh kale lines up with the approximately 0.6g fiber in a tsp of powder kale.So there you have it ladies and gents, 1tsp = about 1/2 c fresh kale when comparing nutrients. That being said, this is obviously an approximation.

This is a surprisingly versatile ingredient and I'm actually on my second bottle! The paprika is not spicy, but has a rather smokey and a little bit sweet pepper taste. It goes perfectly in chili, is great for making your own chorizo, taking deviled eggs up a notch, in a BBQ rub with some brown sugar and salt, and in paella. It is fresh and the flavor is strong enough that a little goes a long way. The only ingredients are: smoked paprika and silicon dioxide. Although I will continue to buy this, heads up it tends to be much cheaper at certain bulk purchasing warehouse stores.

First off, I received a lipstick with the barcode crudely sharpied off which was odd, but that isn't why I'm marking this down. The #001 color looks like a deep cherry red color in the image, and what arrived seemed like it might be a deep red until it was actually put on. What it looks like on is several shades lighter (even taking into account my lighter skin tone) and in pictures showed up more pink than red even without strong lighting or flash involved which was disappointing. It goes on smooth and stays slick without needing any gloss which is nice, but it does not stay put at all. Lipstick was smearing right and left with minimal effort. The fact that it wasn't true to color when worn, and the need to either frequently apply or rely heavily on lip liner or powder to help set it costs the lipstick two stars. It is just ok overall.

After having blown a hole in the arena at the end of Catching Fire, Katniss finds herself aboard a plane headed to District 13, a district believed to have been wiped out after the war many years ago. Katniss becomes aware the revolution is in full swing and she is urged to take her place as the Mockingjay, a living embodiment of the rebels' anti-Capitol symbol modeled after Katniss' token in The Hunger Games which means taking up arms in the battle against President Snow. As the war rages on Katniss struggles to separate friend from foe, and truth from the fiction, all while trying to keep those she loves alive.As a standalone movie it still fits well within the series, it still makes sense to those that have not read any of the books without leaving any gaping plot holes which can be a problem for books turned movie. This movie provides all the set up needed for the final installment while still having a sense of conflict resolution at the end. Another common issue with the whole split finale thing is that too often the first half of the final part just sort of ends leaving the viewer wholly unsatisfied as you never get the feeling anything resolved during the movie you just watched; because of where the director chose to break up the first and second half the audience has a clear break and you are given the satisfaction of having a major part of the end concluded setting up for the rest of the war that will be the central plot of the next/last movie. This is still a good movie, but it is admittedly the more boring of the two halves so hang in there for the final installment! It loses a star because it cannot stand as a movie entirely on its own. You would be pretty lost if you didn't at the very least see Catching Fire.As a treat, here's a couple of deleted scenes: http://www.buzzfeed.com/adambvary/mockingjay-part-1-deleted-scene-drove-fans-insane#.pepwJ52e2As a fan of the books, as well as the movies, I had mixed feelings at first in regards to how it was translated to film. Mockingjay is my favorite of the books in the series and I was curious how faithful the cinematic adaptation would be considering the author was consulted on the making of the movie and on inevitable changes. My mixed feelings stem from the fact that major changes have been made to the movie that I questioned, but after having read an interview that director Francis Lawrence did with Buzzfeed (found here: http://www.buzzfeed.com/adambvary/mockingjay-part-2-katniss-president-snow#.ulBaz5RnR ) I can at least understand why some changes were made for the sake of the non-booking reading audience.******Some of the more prominent deviations from the book discussed below, but kept vague enough to not really spoil anything for non-readers, so if you're afraid of any kind of potential spoiler stop reading here****Effie: Ok, Effie's story has actually been altered. She is reintroduced much earlier than in the books and at District 13. While at first this is annoying and seems pointless to have changed, I suppose it makes sense from a film making perspective to not bring in a different actor to take on a prep team role for the filming of the "propos" when at the end of the day the fans just want the Effie we've all grown to love through the series so bringing her back eliminates the need for the extra casting and gives us our Effie. While personally not a fan of losing the emotional impact of her reintroduction in the book, they tried to maintain that aspect as much as possible by still having her struggle with the differences in lifestyle between the Capitol and District 13.President Coin & District 13: Coin's personality has been muted. Very little time is dedicated to really emphasis how strict and militaristic District 13 is. This is an important deviation when considering the events of the second half of the book.Peeta: I don't know about the rest of the book readers, but I know I definitely wanted the impact of the movie ending in the hospital. Sadly, that is not the case. In an effort to wrap up the first half of the book within the first movie, the end of the movie is extended beyond the Peeta scene. While it definitely takes away from the drama, it makes sense that ultimately movie one is focused on the people that never made it on the plane with Katniss after Catching Fire, and movie two is war focused. Not as fun as the cliffhanger that could have been, but it makes sense to focus each of the final movies on a clear mission that can be wrapped up for the audience which gives that sense of conflict resolution at the end.Snow: You get to see a little more of his family and the moment his granddaughter decides to stop wearing her Katniss inspired braid as a symbol of Katniss becoming public enemy number one. Also, Katniss did not include anything about President Snow in her list of demands to Coin! WHAT?!? The moment she includes her bit about Snow in the demands you know she has hit her breaking point with his crap and losing that is a bummer.The action: The director has clearly set us up for an action filled final movie since most of the action is left out of this one. There's still the important scenes such as when Katniss is visiting District 12, and the bombing of the wounded, however the most exciting part of this movie is Peeta's hospital scene which feels underwhelming compared to just how much happens in the latter half of the book. Even the rescues are toned down. It seems like the director's intent was to focus on Katniss' emotional transition to mockingjay in this movie and then unleashes the full out war with the mockingjay leading the pack in the last one.

I can FINALLY reach the dust on the topside of the fan blades! This has been immensely helpful for dusting between blinds and on fan blades especially for someone that is a bit...height challenged. The duster does an excellent job picking up dust and holding on to it until the job is done instead of having it fly around everywhere settling somewhere else. A little spritz of cleaner on the duster makes it even easier to trap the dust. The duster is extendable and also folds fairly flat for storage. The telescoping body is as simple as twisting to extend or lower, and then twisting to lock it in place. The microfiber can also be removed and run through the laundry as well. I really love this and am glad I purchased it. Other dusters either sucked at picking up the dust, weren't easily washable, or were too long/too short/not able to fold flat taking up too much storage, etc. I would repurchase.

I used this glue for a couple of tasks: 1) To repair a small hole in particle board 2) To patch up a small hole in a door. The particle board hole was the result of a stripped screw so it wasn't particularly large. All I had to do was fill the hole with the wood filler, scrape the excess, let it dry, and re-screw the screw. Had the hole been bigger, it would have been easy enough to first fill with pieces of toothpick and then the wood filler. For the hole in the door it was a little more tricky because it was actually a hollow door which I actually didn't expect to work but figured I'd give it a try! There are bits of what feels like sawdust in the wood filler that add enough texture that it was able to hold onto the edges of the hole and actually create a plug in the door where a screw had gone through which was rather impressive.The filler IS stain-able, but it will not be an exact match to the wood around it so you may still notice where the patch was done. We were able to compensate for it by instead painting and using a little bit lighter of a shade as the filler made a spot that was slightly darker than the rest of the wood.Some have complained that the stuff is nearly impossible to get out of the tube, and they're correct that it requires a bit of force to squeeze this stuff out as it is a thick paste. You can adjust the hole you cut in the tip to be smaller or larger, but the smaller the hole the harder it will be to squeeze out. It is not impossible, but it is annoying enough to have resulted in the loss of a star.
